components: 一 (one) + 度 (times) = もう一度 (one more time!)
一 (one) + 緒 (together) = 一緒 (together)
一 (one) + 人 (person) = 一人 (one person, alone)
labels: FP

components: 一般 (generally, commonly) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 一般的 (ordinary)
description: One of many many Japanese words for 'normal.' The nuance of いっぱんてき　is ordinary, non-special - as opposed to a member of a special group of people of things. 一般的な人 means, an average person. As in, 'an average person is not allowed in this Yakuza bar.'

components: 一 (one) + 日 (sun, day) = 一日 (first day of the month)
labels: FP

components: 一 (one) + 番 (number) = 一番 (number one!)
labels: NEO
description: the best! Number one!

components: 二 (two) + 人 (person) = 二人 (two people)
labels: FP

components: 二 (two) + 月 (moon) = 二月 (February)
labels: KANA

components: 二 (two) + 日 (sun, day) + 酔 (drunk) = 二日酔い (hangover)
labels: SARC
description: hangover (literally: 'paying for your drink'）

components: 二 (two) + 日 (sun, day) = 二日 (second day of the month)
二 (two) + 重 (heavy / overlap) = 二重 (double-xxx)
labels: PRE
description: PREFIX meaning double, as in "double-chin" or "twin-engine plane."

components: 三 (three) + 人 (person) = 三人 (can you guess?!???)
三 (three) + 月 (moon) = 三月 (March)
labels: KANA

components: 三 (three) + 角 (horn/corner) = 三角 (triangle)
完 (complete) + 了 (total) = 完了 (finish)
labels: NP
description: to finish work on a project - an annual report, a re-formatting of the database, etc.

components: 了 (total) + 解 (solve / untie) = 了解 (OK, got it.)
description: roger that! ('I got it!') (originally used by military, but now often used when you text, because of its brevity)!

components: 終 (end) + 了 (total) = 終了 (expire)
labels: NP
description: to expire, to come to an end (used about contracts or subscriptions expiring)

components: 子 (child) + 供 (follower) = 子供 (child)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 親 (parents/kindness) + 子 (child) = 親子 (meat and eggs)
labels: SARC KUNKUN
description: parents and child together - also the rather cruel name for a traditional dish: boiled chicken served with scrambled eggs.

components: 調 (check out) + 子 (child) = 調子 (condition)
description: the condition something's in. Can be used with a living thing or object. Always used only with いい or 悪い. Usually emphaizes the LONG TERM condition. Although hungover people have been heard to remark, 調子が悪い！

labels: FP 1/2 KANA

components: 車 (car) + 子 (chair) = 車椅子 (wheelchair)
labels: KUNKUN NEO

components: 彼 (him) + 女 (woman) = 彼女 (her / girlfriend)
description: her. Might also mean 'girlfriend' depending on context.

components: 女 (woman) + 人 (person) = 女の人 (woman)
description: the polite- but not formal - way to say woman

components: 女 (woman) + 子 (child) = 女の子 (girl)
description: girl . Newspapers use it for a female up through junior high, but guys talking about 'chicks,dude' might use it to refer to a 20 year old.

components: 少 (a little (amount)) + 女 (woman) = 少女 (young girl)
description: young girl - usually 5- 15 years old.

components: 女 (woman) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 女性 (female)
description: female - emphasizes biology, (sex, rather than gender).

components: 女 (woman) + 子 (child) = 女子 (female xxx / xxx for girls)
labels: PRE
description: PREFIX used about women from first grade through college. Used to refer to female students as a group: "女子 line up on the left side of the class, 男子 (danshi) line up on the right side." BOOBOO: You wouldn't say "She's a joshi."

components: 女子 (female xxx / xxx for girls) + 高 (tall) + 生 (life / birth) = 女子高生 (high school girl.)
大 (big) + 好 (like) = 大好き (really like)
格 (character, aspect) + 好 (like) = 格好 (looks)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description:
literally, 'look' or 'shape,' as in 'He's dressed as a woman' : おんなの格好してる。

But　usually it means 'coolness:' かっこいい (cool) or かっこうわるい (not).(when used in the figurative, 'cool' sense, it is usually KANA)

meaning: try too hard to be cool
components: 格 (character, aspect) + 好 (like) = 格好つける (try too hard to be cool)
labels: KANA
description: this is a rad one. it means "try too hard to be cool". (Literally "manufacturing coolness")

components: 好 (like) + 奇 (strange) + 心 (heart) = 好奇心 (curiosity)
description:
curiosity

BOOBOO: if you want to say you're curious about a specific thing, you'd use 興味　（きょうみ） instead.

好奇心 usually means "curiosity-in-general": 　you have an inquiring personality, or a gaze of curiosity on your face. You'd never say, "Oh, you play in a band? 好奇心ある！”

components: 強 (burly) + 姦 (rape) = 強姦 (rape)
labels: FP

components: 法 (law) + 定 (plan) + 強姦 (rape) = 法定強姦 (statuatory rape)
labels: NP

components: 近 (near) + 親 (parents/kindness) + 相 (partner) + 姦 (rape) = 近親相姦 (incest)
labels: ABU

components: 獣 (beast) + 姦 (rape) = 獣姦 (bestiality)
labels: ABU

components: 死 (death) + 姦 (rape) = 死姦 (necrophilia)
labels: ABU

components: 出 (pull out / hand over) + 口 (mouth) = 出口 (exit.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 入 (put/go in) + 口 (mouth) = 入り口 (entrance)
labels: NOKURI
description: entrance (often shortened to 入口）

components: 悪 (bad) + 口 (mouth) = 悪口 (talking shit about someone.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 銀行 (bank) + 口 (mouth) + 座 (sit) = 銀行口座 (bank account)
口 (mouth) + 説 (explain) = 口説く (pester)
description: pester someone, usually for sex

components: 人 (person) + 口 (mouth) = 人口 (population)
窓 (window) + 口 (mouth) = 窓口 (service window)
labels: KUNKUN
description: the kind of depressing place where you get a ticket or food from a person in a box with usually a bulletproof plexiglas window between you and them.

components: 口 (mouth) + 実 (truth) = 口実 (pretext)
description: a pretext. Like, "I'm studying to be a preacher, but that's just a pretext for me to meet virgin dudes."

components: 商 (merchandise) + 品 (products) = 商品 (items for sale, merchandise)
作 (make) + 品 (products) = 作品 (artworks.)
下 (below) + 品 (products) = 下品 (crude)
description: crude. Like chicks sitting with their legs open or guys picking their nose.

components: 新 (new) + 品 (products) = 新品 (new items)
description: brand new shit - just on the market

components: 上 (above) + 品 (products) = 上品 (sophisticated)
description: can be used of people or things. It means graceful or sophisticated in a quiet or understated way. When it comes to people, 上品 is usually used about women, I mean 'ladies.'

components: 言 (say) + 葉 (leaf) = 言葉 (any word)
labels: FP
description: ANY word - unlike the related term 単語（たんご）、　言葉 can refer to compound words, or onomonopoeia. Also 言葉 can mean "way of speaking." There are expressions like "watch what you say!" that use 言葉 this way: 言葉使い が丁寧 (her way of speaking is very polite!) or 言葉大切につかいましょう （let's be careful how we speak!)

components: 助 (save) + 言 (say) = 助言 (advice)
言 (say) + 語 (language) + 壁 (wall) = 言語の壁 (the language barrier )
labels: NEO

components: 片 (fragment) + 言 (say) = 片言 (broken english / Japanese)
labels: KUNKUN FP
description: we say "He speaks broken English".Japanese say, "He speaks katakoto nihongo."

components: 言 (say) + 葉 (leaf) + 遣 (apply) = 言葉遣い (one's choice of words)
labels: KANA

components: 地 (area) + 下 (below) + 鉄 (iron) = 地下鉄 (subway)
下 (below) + 手 (hand) = 下手 (untalented / poor)
labels: FP
description: XXX is untalented, poorly performed, or poorly made.

components: 下 (below) + 痢 (diarrhea) = 下痢 (diarrhea )
不 (un) + 思 (think) + 議 (discussion) = 不思議 (mystery)
description: a mystery or unexplainable thing. BOOBOO:NOT a mystery like Sherlock Holmes or "Colonel Mustard, in the drawing room, with the double-headed dildo." A mystery like how fat Americans are, or why Sting is famous. That's a fushigi.

components: 不 (un) + 安 (cheap / safe) = 不安 (unease)
不 (un) + 便 (convenient　/ poop) = 不便 (inconvenient)
不 (un) + 足 (foot/ be enough) = 不足 (shortage of)
labels: NP
description: To not have enough of a physical thing (money, time, nurses, teachers.) Also implies that there is a specific amount that is required, For example -犬不足 (a dog shortage). There's no particle or verb needed.

components: 不 (un) + 倫 (principles) = 不倫 (affair)
description: an affair - cheating

components: 否定 (a formal word for 'to deny' (the politician denied the allegations)) + 形 (form) = 否定形 (a negative sentence)
description: a negative sentence. 'He doesn't , we don't, I can not,' are examples of English negatives. ひていけい is a good word to know if you want to ask your friends, 'How do you use this word in the negative?'

meaning: a formal word for 'to deny' (the politician denied the allegations)
components: 否 (no) + 定 (plan) = 否定 (a formal word for 'to deny' (the politician denied the allegations))
labels: NP

components: 拒 (repel) + 否 (no) = 拒否 (refuse!!!!)
labels: ABU
description:
absolute refusal- unlike 拒む (こばむ）,　拒否 is always verbal - an exit line. Like if you tell a guy 'no thanks' 10 times and he won't go away, you use 拒否. As in, '私がきょひした。’

Oh no you di'int!

components: 十 (ten) + 円 (yen/circle) = 十円 (ten yen.)
十 (ten) + 月 (moon) = 十月 (October)
labels: KANA FP

meaning: the tenth day of the month
components: 十 (ten) + 日 (sun, day) = 十日 (the tenth day of the month )
labels: FP

components: 十 (ten) + 月 (moon) + 間 (a period of time) = 十ヶ月間 (ten months' time)
description:
about that little "ヶ" thing - it's pronounced KA, and means "number of months' time". If you take it out, you'd be left with "十月", meaning October.

It's the difference between "It's October, the tenth month of the solar year" and "I haven't seen your mom's Ricky Martin sex-tape youtube in a whole ten months!"

components: 二 (two) + 十 (ten) + 歳 (years old) = 二十歳 (twenty years old)
labels: CCW FP
description: twenty years old - traditionally the age at which Japanese turn into adults and get presents, kimono, etc. So, naturally it has its own special pronunciation that doesn't make any sense, since it SHOULD be called にじゅうさい。 Whatever. Tradition.

components: 十 (ten) + 戒 (admonish / commandment) = 十戒 (the ten commandments.)
labels: FP

components: 中 (middle) + 古 (old) = 中古 (used XXX )
description: used XXX (books, cars, your dad's condoms)

components: 古 (old) + 着 (wear / arrive) = 古着 (used clothes)
labels: KUNKUN
description: used clothes - a used clothes store is a 古着屋（ふるぎや）

components: 古 (old) + 典 (classic) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 古典的 (classical)
description: classical, like Shakespeare or Bach or Shunga something.

components: 時 (time) + 計 (measure) = 時計 (watch or clock )
labels: FP

components: 合 (to suit) + 計 (measure) = 合計 (total)
計 (measure) + 画 (a drawing) = 計画 (plan)
labels: FP
description: Pretty close to 予定　（よてい） in meaning, but perhaps more elaborate - you'd use 計画 to say "I have a plan to get rich!" or to say "I planned out our whole vacation to 3 countries." . . but you wouldn't use 予定。

components: 余 (excess) + 計 (measure) = 余計 (uncalled-for)
description: excessive, uncalled-for, and unnecessary (usually used in the context of 余計なお世話だよ！　（よけいなおせわだよ！）: 'Mind your own business!')

components: 計 (measure) + 算 (calculate) = 計算 (to calculate)
七 (seven) + 月 (moon) = 七月 (July )
labels: KANA FP

components: 七 (seven) + 時 (time) = 七時 (7 o'clock)
labels: FP

components: 七 (seven) + 千 (thousand) + 円 (yen/circle) = 七千円 (７，０００ yen.)

meaning: the seventh day of the month
components: 七 (seven) + 日 (sun, day) = 七日 (the seventh day of the month)
labels: FP

components: 七 (seven) + 面 (front surface / face) + 鳥 (bird) = 七面鳥 (turkey )
比較 (compare) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 比較的 (comparatively)
labels: NP
description: comparatively (BOOBOO: you DON'T use a 'na' at the end, for some reason)

components: 比 (compare) + 較 (evaluate) = 比較 (compare)
labels: NP
description: a more formal word for 'compare': You'd 比べる AC/DC albums to see which one rocked the most, but you'd 比較 the GDP of developing nations.

components: 比 (compare) + 率 (ratio) = 比率 (ratio)
昨 (yesterday) + 日 (sun, day) = 昨日 (yesterday)
labels: FP

components: 今 (now) + 日 (sun, day) = 今日 (today)
labels: FP

components: 明 (bright) + 日 (sun, day) = 明日 (tomorrow)
labels: FP

components: 曜 (day of the week) + 日 (sun, day) = 曜日 (day of week)
labels: KUN ON SUF COUNTER
description: Day of the week (BOOBOO； in practice, most Japanese omit the final '日'.So, 木曜日(もくようび） becomes simply 木曜 (もくよう）)

components: 日 (sun, day) + 米 (rice / America) = 日米 (east-and-west)
description: add 日, (which is short for 日本), to 米, (which somehow means "America"), and you have a word which means "East-and-West" or "East meets West." Usually seen on cultural exchange-related things.

components: 昆 (insect) + 虫 (insizzect) = 昆虫 (insect)
labels: NP
description: insect, (a more scientific term than 'むし')

components: 液 (liquid) + 晶 (crystal) = 液晶 (liquid crystal display)
labels: NEO

components: 旧 (former) + 姓 (family name) = 旧姓 (maiden name)
復 (return or re-do) + 旧 (former) = 復旧する (to resume service)
素 (element) + 早 (early) = 素早い (agility)
description: physical speed or agility, but without any advanced kung-fu techniques. A fast bird or lizard. Doing a simple task at the office, but very speedily.

components: 早 (early) + 速 (fast) = 早速 (do XXX immediately!)
labels: FP 1/2 KANA
1/2 KANA
description: the more informal, spoken word for husband (your own or other peoples') - (BOOBOO: if you're talking about someone else's man, say お旦那さん (more polite!))

meaning: once you've started to do xxx . . .
components: 一 (one) + 旦 (danna (husband)) = 一旦 (once you've started to do xxx . . .)
labels: KANA
description: once you've started to do xxx . . . (i.e. once you've gotten married, you can't get divorced! once you've promised, you can't go back on it!)

components: 面 (front surface / face) + 白 (white) = 面白*い (interesting)
labels: SARC FP
description: interesting, (in a good way) but also can mean funny (as in, laughing at you!) this deliberate ambiguity being a big thing with Japanese Sarcasm. Although in this case, fully half the time people are being serious.

components: 白 (white) + 人 (person) = 白人 (white people)
labels: NEO
description: white people (do the Humpty Hump, they do the humpty hump)

components: 白 (white) + 黒 (black) = 白黒 (black-and-white)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 皆 (everyone) + 様 (important person) = 皆様 (everyone)
labels: KUNKUN F
description: a more formal way to say "everyone."

components: 水 (water) + 曜日 (day of week) = 水曜日 (Wednesday)
labels: KUN ON

components: 水 (water) + 着 (wear / arrive) = 水着 (swim-suit)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 香 (good smell) + 水 (water) = 香水 (perfume)
水 (water) + 族 (family) + 館 (big hall) = 水族館 (aquarium)

meaning: hostess clubs, host clubs,strip clubs, etc.
components: 水 (water) + 商売 (a business) = 水商売 (hostess clubs, host clubs,strip clubs, etc.)
labels: KUN ON

components: 洪 (flood) + 水 (water) = 洪水 (flood)
description: flood (be careful - the す is pronounced ず、which is really unusual.)

components: 水 (water) + 滴 (drip) = 水滴 (drop of water)
description: a drop of water

components: 排 (eliminate) + 水 (water) + 溝 (ditch) = 排水溝 (big ditch.)
description: big ditch. who cares.

components: 温 (hot or warm thing) + 泉 (spring) = 温泉 (hot spring bath)
description: hot spring baths (although most onsen use artificially heated water from regular wells these days)

components: 氷 (ice) + 山 (mountain) = 氷山 (iceberg)
永 (forever) + 遠 (far) = 永遠 (poetic forever)
description: the poetic 'forever'： I'll hate you forever! We shall rule the world forever!

components: 永 (forever) + 久 (been a long time) = 永久 (forever )
description: forever - the science word. (BOOBOO : the poetic word is 'eien'.(永遠))

components: 一 (one) + 泊 (stay for the night) = 一泊 (one night's stay)
labels: COUNTER
description: a COUNTER for the number of nights you stay. You use this when making a reservation at a hotel. Ippaku is , of course, one night.

meaning: to stay somewhere for two nights.
components: 二 (two) + 泊 (stay for the night) = 二泊 (to stay somewhere for two nights.)
宿 (lodge at) + 泊 (stay for the night) = 宿泊 (stay the night)
labels: NP
description: the act of staying the night -(kind of formal; you might read it in a hotel guidebook, but you wouldn't say "Let's 宿泊 over there, guys!"

components: 果 (fruit　/ result) + 汁 (juice, soup) = 果汁 (fruit juice)
混 (mix) + 乱 (disorder) = 混乱 (confusion)
description: What you are experiencing right now while studying Japanese!

components: 先 (earlier/ the tip) + 月 (moon) = 先月 (last month)
来 (come/future) + 月 (moon) = 来月 (next month)
今 (now) + 月 (moon) = 今月 (this month)
三 (three) + 月 (moon) + 間 (a period of time) = 三ヶ月間 (three months' time)
description: three months' time, three months' duration

components: 正 (correct) + 月 (moon) = 正月 (the New Year)
description: the New Year - (BOOBOO: in Japan, that means not just January first but the whole first week)

components: 説 (explain) + 明 (bright) = 説明 (explain)
description: Explanation / to explain

components: 不 (un) + 明 (bright) = 不明 (unknown, unclear)
labels: NP
description: unknown, unclear. (the body's identity remains unknown / an unknown tribe made these carvings of your mama's ass)

kanji: 明けましておめでとう
reading: あけましておめでとう!
labels: BOOBOO
description: Happy new year! (only noobs say this before Jan 1st. In the last part of December, we say, "良いお年を!" (よいおとしを!)

components: 脂 (animal fat) + 肪 (fatty food) = 脂肪 ( grease or fat)
description: grease or fat (refers to both the kind used in cooking, AND the kind that makes your mama's neighbors take out earthquake insurance )

components: 大 (big) + 胆 (gall bladder / daring) = 大胆 (daring or bold)
description: daring or bold, - not just courageous, but taking risks when you don't need to. Not just a bank-robbery, but a bank robbery at high noon, while wearing Hirohito masks!.

components: 朝 (morning) + 日 (sun, day) = 朝日 (rising sun)
labels: KUNKUN
description: rising sun. As in, 'land of the. . .' Also as in Asahi beer.

components: 朝 (morning) + 刊 (edition) = 朝刊 (morning edition)
火 (fire) + 曜日 (day of week) = 火曜日 (Tuesday)
labels: KUN ON

components: 火 (fire) + 事 (action/ incident) = 火事 (fire)
description: A fire - not like the fire in your stepdad's crackpipe; like the fire that spreads from his crackpipe and engulfs your whole trailer.

components: 花 (flower) + 火 (fire) = 花火 (fireworks)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 炎 (flame) + 症 (symptom) = 炎症 (inflammation)
description: inflammation, swelling

components: 冗 (joke) + 談 (consult) = 冗談 (joke)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: a joke - you'll often hear: "冗談じゃない！” ('I'm not kidding!')

components: 相 (partner) + 談 (consult) = 相談 (consult)
description: a consultation - it doesn't have to be formal. If you want to see your teacher after class, that's a soudan.

components: 丁 (nail) + 目 (eye) = 丁目 (city block)
labels: KUN ON COUNTER
description: a COUNTER for - roughly, 'city block.' 3丁目, 4丁目, etc. You need to know this if you ever want to read an address.

components: 丁 (nail) + 度 (times) = 丁度 (just right)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: exactly, precisely. Just right.

labels: 1/2 KANA
description: manners used in everyday situations. Just good common sense.

components: 包 (wrap) + 丁 (nail) = 包丁 (kitchen knife, cutlery)
街 (shopping district) + 灯 (streetlight) = 街灯 (streetlight)

meaning: lamp -(BOOBOO: in practice, everyone just says でんき)
components: 電 (electricity) + 灯 (streetlight) = 電灯 (lamp -(BOOBOO: in practice, everyone just says でんき) )
labels: NP

components: 懐 (nostalgia) + 中 (middle) + 電灯 (lamp -(BOOBOO: in practice, everyone just says でんき) ) = 懐中電灯 (flashlight)
可 (possible) + 愛 (love) = 可愛い (cute!)
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 可 (possible) + 能 (talent) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 可能性 (possibility)
許 (allow) + 可 (possible) = 許可 (permission)
不 (un) + 可 (possible) + 能 (talent) = 不可能 (not possible)
可 (possible) + 燃 (burn) = 可燃ゴミ (burnable garbage)
河 (stream) + 童 (kid) = 河童 (the green frog-monster)
labels: KANA
description: a traditional monster, one you'll still see all the time in illustrations or storefronts. They used to be crazy vicious, jumping up out of the lake and eating your intestines while you're still alive, but now they're more like cute, mischievous mascots -

components: 訂 (revise) + 正 (correct) = 訂正 ( correct or revise )
description: to correct or revise some written thing - lyrics, a report, an article, or even (god forbid) a Kanji book.

components: 田 (rice field) + 舎 (stable) = 田舎 (countryside)
labels: FP
description: the countryside,hicksville

components: 入 (put/go in) + 院 (institution) = 入院 (check in hospital)
description: check into the hospital - not for a simple exam, but like you have to stay there at least one night, you're too sick to leave.

meaning: to start school at a new school
components: 入 (put/go in) + 学 (knowledge) = 入学 (to start school at a new school)
入 (put/go in) + 館 (big hall) + 料 (ingredients / fees) = 入館料 (admission fee)
labels: NP
KUN ON SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning 'person from XXX country.' AmerikaJIN, FranceJIN, etc.

components: 人 (person) + 気 (mood) = 人気 (famous)
description: famous - usually used like this: 人気　が　ある！

components: 人 (person) + 間 (a period of time) = 人間 (human)
labels: FP

components: 人 (person) + 生 (life / birth) = 人生 (life (in general))
description: Life, as in someone's entire life, or life in general:. "He lived a quiet life." "Life is a bitch." "Life span."

components: 名 (name, famous) + 人 (person) = 名人 (an expert)
大 (big) + 人 (person) = 大人 (adult)
labels: FP
description: adult, as opposed to minor, not as opposed to 'with clothes on.'

components: 目 (eye) + 上 (above) + 人 (person) = 目上の人 (higher person)
labels: KUNKUN
description: someone who out-ranks you - at work, school, or in society.

components: 人 (person) + 食 (eat) = 人食い (a man-eating XXX.)
何 (what?!?) + 時 (time) = 何時 (what time is it?)

labels: ABU

components: 幾 (how much?) + 何 (what?!?) + 学 (knowledge) = 幾何学 (geometry)
labels: FR FP
description: geometry (I like this because it seems that even the Chinese sages who made up this word were confused by geometry. It's like 'the science of what the fuck??')

components: 自 (my own) + 信 (believe) = 自信 (self-confidence)
信 (believe) + 号 (ID number) = 信号 (signal)
description: signal, i.e. traffic signal

components: 迷 (perplexed) + 信 (believe) = 迷信 (superstition)
変 (change) + 化 (transform) = 変化 (transformation, change)
文 (culture/ sentence) + 化 (transform) = 文化 (culture)
進 (progress) + 化 (transform) = 進化 (evolution)
機械 (machine) + 化 (transform) = 機械化 (mechanization )
description: the mechanization of a society or of an industry.

components: 花 (flower) + 見 (look) = 花見 (sakura-viewing party)
labels: KUNKUN
description: cherry-blossom looking-at-and-getting-bombed parties

components: 苦 (suffer) + 労 (labor) = 苦労 (hardships)
苦 (suffer) + 手 (hand) = 苦手 (this is not my thing!)
labels: KUNKUN
description: this has 2 meanings. One is "I'm not good at this" and the second is "I don't like this" Clever Japanese!

components: 苦 (suffer) + 情 (emotion) = 苦情 (a grievance or complaint )
荷 (luggage) + 物 (animal / thing) = 荷物 (luggage)
labels: FP
description: luggage or belongings. Also, cargo (if you're a ship's captain). Also, emotional baggage, or a metaphorical burden

components: 内 (the inside) + 容 (appearance) = 内容 (contents)
description: the contents (of a box or a book or whatever)

components: 案 (guide/proposal) + 内 (the inside) = 案内 (guide)
description: a guide - usually in the form of a map, or an information kiosk. Also if a clerk shows you around a store pointing out things you might want to buy, that 's annai.

components: 以 (compared to) + 内 (the inside) = 以内 (within)
description: within xxx (as in, "I'll be there within 10 minutes!")

components: 内 (the inside) + 緒 (together) = 内緒 (confidential)
labels: KIDS
description: usually defined as 'confidential,' but that makes it sound more serious than it is - like a spy document or something. Actually, 内緒 is kind of a kids' word. "Keep this information between us two."

components: 筋 (muscle) + 肉 (meat) = 筋肉 (muscle)
皮 (skin) + 肉 (meat) = 皮肉 (sarcasm/irony)
labels: SARC
description: sarcasm OR irony. Japanese DO have a sense of sarcasm,(for example, calling the traditional chicken-and-scrambled-eggs dish "parents and child") but it is so different than the Western say-the-opposite-of-what-you-mean style that Japanese don't have a word for western sarc. So they seem to have taken their word for Irony and pressed it into service for sarcasm as well.

components: 豚 (pig) + 肉 (meat) = 豚肉 (pork )
labels: KUNKUN

components: 焼 (roast / grill) + 肉 (meat) = 焼肉 (roast meat, usually beef.)
labels: NOKURI

components: 牛 (cow) + 肉 (meat) = 牛肉 (beef)
百 (hundred) + 円 (yen/circle) = 百円 (１００ yen)
一 (one) + 億 (a hundred million) + 円 (yen/circle) = 一億円 (100,000,000 YEN)
description: 100,000,000 YEN,　 AKA what Maneki-neko wants!

components: 市 (small city) + 長 (long / boss) = 市長 (mayor)
市 (small city) + 民 (folk) = 市民 (citizens of a city)

labels: SUF
description: Suffix meaning, "xxx City"

components: 株式 (stocks) + 市 (small city) + 場 (place) = 株式市場 (stock market)
labels: NEO
description: 株式（stocks)＋地場(marketplace)＝the stock market！

labels: ABU
description: a disrespectful way for a guy to yell at a lady he doesn't know. Kind of like, 'Hey sweetheart, go make me some tea!'

components: 姉 (older sister) + 妹 (little sister) = 姉妹 (sisters)
目 (eye) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 目的 (motive, not only for crimes.)

meaning: to stand out in a crowd.
components: 目 (eye) + 立 (stand up) = 目立つ (to stand out in a crowd.)
番 (number) + 目 (eye) = 番目 (thing in a row)
labels: KUNKUN COUNTER
description: this is a term used in counting things in a row. For instance, in English we'd say "Second book from the right" or "Third shelf from the top" in Japanese, they'd say: 2番目のbook OR 4番目のshelf.

components: 駄 (bad quality) + 目 (eye) = 駄目 (no way!)
labels: KANA KUNKUN
description: this has so many meanings: useless, bad, 'stop!' or just 'no way!'

components: 目 (eye) + 次 (next) = 目次 (table of contents)
目 (eye) + 撃 (charge) + 者 (professional) = 目撃者 (a witness to a crime.)
labels: NP

components: 冒 (dare) + 険 (steep / risky) = 冒険 (adventure)
帽 (hat) + 子 (child) = 帽子 (hat)
自 (my own) + 由 (freedom / reason) = 自由 (freedom)
自 (my own) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 自分 (one's own)
description: one's own (dog, blunt, fungus, etc.) - BOOBOO: sometimes it also is used to mean "you" or "she", as in "She did it herself, as opposed to having others do it for her."

components: 自衛 (self-defense) + 隊 (troop) = 自衛隊 (Japan's army)
description: Japan's army, in English called the SDF (self-defense forces)

components: 自 (my own) + 業 (business) + 得 (bargain　/ obtain) = 自業自得 ("I brought this on myself!")

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX, meaning 'name of restaurant' . So you can tell "Joe's亭" (Joe's diner)　apart from "Joe's本屋"　（Joe's bookstore)

components: 停 (bring to a halt) + 止 (stop) = 停止 (suspension or stoppage)
labels: NP
description: suspension or stoppage (i.e. they cut my electricity because I didn't pay the bill). This is usually used in official announcements or bills. You wouldn't say to your friend, "I 停止-ed watching TV."

components: 各 (each) + 駅 (train station) + 停 (bring to a halt) + 車 (car) = 各駅停車 (local train)
description: sure this is a scary and long word, but if you live here, you'll use it everyday： It means "local train" (literally, "stopping at each station train")

components: 卒 (graduate) + 業 (business) = 卒業 (to graduate)

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning, 'way to do.' for instance, ギターを弾く； means 'to play the guitar.' so,ギターの弾き方； means 'the way to play the guitar.'

components: 方 (direction / method / person) + 法 (law) = 方法 (method )
仕 (work) + 方 (direction / method / person) = 仕方 (way to do something)
description: Most often used in the negative: 'Shikata ga nai.' as in, 'fuck it.'

components: 方 (direction / method / person) + 向 (turn to face) = 方向 (direction)
一 (one) + 方 (direction / method / person) = 一方 (one-sided)
description: one-sided, one-way. Often used in the phrase : xxx 一方だ！ (meaning, more and more xxx - i.e. "more and more hot", "more and more popular," etc.)

components: 万 (10000) + 一 (one) = 万が一 (just in case)
labels: NP
description: just in case (literally, 'on the one-in-10,000 chance that something goes wrong')

components: 万 (10000) + 歳 (years old) = 万歳 (banzai!)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: Fuckin' banzai, man!!!! (literally '10,000 years', meaning, 'May the Emperor live 10,000 years!' is what you shout as you charge into battle)

components: 万 (10000) + 引 (pull) = 万引き (shoplift.)
labels: SARC

components: 訪 (formal visit) + 問 (question, problem) = 訪問 (a formal visit)
labels: NP
description: same as たずねる,(訪ねる）, but it's a noun.

components: 妨 (prevent) + 害 (damage) = 妨害 (interference)
description: interference - a person interferes with you. (妨害 is used with people, while the related term 阻害（そがい） is used about objects）

components: 双 (pair) + 子 (child) = 双子 (twins)
labels: KUNKUN FP

components: 奴 (servant / dood) + 等 (equal /etc./plural) = 奴等 (Those dudes)
labels: KUNKUN
description: "Those dudes." One of the only plurals in Japanese!

components: 文 (culture/ sentence) + 字 (letter) = 文字 (a letter)
labels: FP
description: a letter- whether kana, kanji, or alphabet.

components: 注 (pour / be careful) + 文 (culture/ sentence) = 注文 (order)
description: to order an item - both in a store and by mail. Also, if you ask your friend to do an annoying and detailed favor, like, "Could you do the laundry again with this other kind of soap!", that's chuumon.

components: 文 (culture/ sentence) + 学 (knowledge) = 文学 (literature)
心 (heart) + 配 (distribute) = 心配 (worry)
心 (heart) + 臓 (internal organ) = 心臓 (heart)
安 (cheap / safe) + 心 (heart) = 安心 (a feeling of relief)
愛 (love) + 国 (country) + 心 (heart) = 愛国心 (patriotism)
思 (think) + 出 (pull out / hand over) = 思い出す (remember)
description:
to remember something

This word uses the particle を　（even though plain ole' 思う uses と !!)

（BOOBOO: don't do like me and spend 3 years confusing 思い出す with 覚える、 which means 'to memorize.')

components: 思 (think) + 出 (pull out / hand over) = 思い出 (a memory)
description: a specific memory (BOOBOO : GENERAL memory - as in, "I'm losing my memory!" - is a different word : 記憶 (きおく))

components: 思 (think) + 出 (pull out / hand over) = 思い出せない (I don't remember)

labels: KUNKUN FP
description: last night (BOOBOO: it's NOT pronounced "tabe!!", even though it looks like it!)

components: 夕 (evening) + 方 (direction / method / person) = 夕方 (evening)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 夕 (evening) + 焼 (roast / grill) = 夕焼け (sunset)
夕 (evening) + 刊 (edition) = 夕刊 (evening edition)
多 (many) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 多分 (maybe)
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 多 (many) + 数 (integer, to count) = 多数 (a big number of XXX)

description: too damn many. Too damn many gaijin if you ask me. Always doing crimes. They need to just buy our products and get out.

components: 今 (now) + 夜 (late night) = 今夜 (tonight)

meaning: in the middle of the night.
components: 深 (deep) + 夜 (late night) = 深夜 (in the middle of the night. )
有 (exist) + 名 (name, famous) = 有名 (famous)
名 (name, famous) + 前 (before) = 名前 (name)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 名 (name, famous) + 刺 (stab / buisness card) = 名刺 (business card)
description: business card　－ AKA "name card" (ネームカード） in Japanese-English.

components: 名 (name, famous) + 字 (letter) = 名字 (family name)
labels: FP
description: one's last name - like 姓, but 名字 is a spoken word, as well as written.

components: 外 (outside) + 人 (person) = 外人 (foreigner)
description: foreigner (the more formal term is　外国人 （がいこくじん）, but plain old 外人 is not neccesairly rude. It all depends on the tone)

components: 以 (compared to) + 外 (outside) = 以外 (other than xxx)
description: other than xxx / except for xxx.

components: 例 (example) + 外 (outside) = 例外 (exception)
description: an exception to a rule

components: 案 (guide/proposal) + 外 (outside) = 案外 (more than one expected)
description: more/less/weirder than you expected.

components: 季 (season) + 節 (season / joint) + 外 (outside) = 季節外れ (out of season.)
以 (compared to) + 上 (above) = 以上 (more than / that's all)
labels: JERK
description: ２ meanings. usually said when you finish ordering something (food, copies, condoms) ； 'That'll be all.' It also means, "on top of all that" or "more than" (used like xxx以上、or sometimes also 以上　のｘｘｘ）

components: 上 (above) + 手 (hand) = 上手 (skilllfully done!)
labels: FP
description: skillfully done! Usually used to praise one's friends' efforts (at art, music, cooking, etc.)

components: 上 (above) + 級 (level) = 上級 (advanced-level)
description: advanced level. When you finish this book, you'll still be a beginner of kanji but you'll have advanced level skills at making people aware of problems in life that their Moms might face.

components: 独 (solitary) + 占 (fortune teller/ occupy) = 独占 (monopoly)
交 (combine) + 差 (discriminate) + 点 (point) = 交差点 (intersection)
description: traffic intersection

components: 共 (with) + 通 (pass) + 点 (point) = 共通点 (common point)
description: common point (between two things or people)

components: 要 (important) + 点 (point) = 要点 (the important points)
description:
the important points (unlike the related word 重点（じゅうてん）、　要点 is more than one point - more like a summary. Like instead of writing an essay, you'd just do a series of bullet points.
Example phrase:要点だけ話して！　("Get to the point!")

components: 安 (cheap / safe) + 全 (all) = 安全 (safety)
慰 (console) + 安 (cheap / safe) + 婦 (housewife / lady) = 慰安婦 ("comfort women")
labels: ABU
description: the Korean 'comfort women' enslaved during the war, which Japan still won't make amends to.

components: 漢 (Chinese) + 字 (letter) = 漢字 (kanji)
description: of course

components: マ () + 字 (letter) = ローマ字 (western, Roman letters. A,b,c,d,y,o,m,a,m,a)
数 (integer, to count) + 字 (letter) = 数字 (a numeral - 1,2,3, etc.)
八 (eight) + 月 (moon) = 八月 (August)
labels: KANA

components: 八 (eight) + 日 (sun, day) = 八日 (eighth day of the month)
labels: FP

components: 八 (eight) + 重 (heavy / overlap) + 歯 (tooth) = 八重歯 (gnarly teeth)
labels: FP
description: the gnarled, wish-I-had-braces teeth that Japanese are famous for. Lots of Japanese find it cute, in fact.

components: 六 (six) + 日 (sun, day) = 六日 (sixth day of the month)
labels: FP

components: 六 (six) + 月 (moon) = 六月 (June)
labels: KANA

components: 公 (public) + 園 (public park) = 公園 (park)
description: a public park

components: 公 (public) + 開 (open) = 公開 (open to the public)
公 (public) + 共 (with) = 公共 (public)
description: public, as in "public toilet" or "public telephone"

components: 一 (one) + 台 (big thing counter) = 一台 (one big thing)
labels: COUNTER
description: one big thing, well, bigger than 一個(いっこ) anyway... 一個 is used for apples, marbles, maybe a melon. 一台 is used for anything from a TV set on up to a car!

components: 台 (big thing counter) + 風 (wind / the flu / style) = 台風 (taiphoon)
台 (big thing counter) + 所 (area / attribute) = 台所 (kitchen!)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 台 (big thing counter) + 湾 (bay) = 台湾 (Taiwan )
自 (my own) + 立 (stand up) = 自立 (independence)
description: sometimes translated as 'independence'、自立 is more an attitude of self-reliance. A kid who gets a job, moves out of her parents' house, who does things for herself.

meaning: to work like it's supposed to
components: 役 (role) + 立 (stand up) = 役に立つ (to work like it's supposed to)
description: to be useful, to work like it's supposed to (used about things, not humans)

components: 腹 (entrails) + 立 (stand up) = 腹が立つ (get mad )
県 (prefecture) + 立 (stand up) = 県立 (prefectural)
description: prefectural (hospital, capital, etc.)

components: 音 (sound) + 楽 (enjoy) = 音楽 (music!)
発 (launch) + 音 (sound) = 発音 (pronunciation of a word)

meaning: The kanji pronunciation one uses in compound words.
components: 音 (sound) + 読 (read) = 音読み (The kanji pronunciation one uses in compound words.)
description: yep.

components: 擬 (sham) + 音 (sound) + 語 (language) = 擬音語 (Onomatopoeia!)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: Onomatopoeia!!!! Sound-effect words. in English, that means words like 'slap' 'smack' or 'splash.'

components: 専 (specialty) + 門 (gate) = 専門 (a specialty)
時 (time) + 間 (a period of time) = 時間 (time)
間 (a period of time) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 間違い (a mistake)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: Verb form; 間違える！

labels: SUF
description:
xxx amount of time.

You can't just say "one year" like in English. You have to add 'kan', the equivalent of saying, in English, 'one year's time.'

for instance:

一年間 (いちねんかん）:one year's time

三週間 (さんしゅうかん）: three weeks' time

With months, it gets even more complex: you have to add 間 at the end AND ヶ (pronounced 'ka') in the middle, like this:

三ヶ月間 (さんかげつかん）: three months' time

components: 間 (a period of time) + 合 (to suit) = 間に合う (make it in time)
description: to make it in time - catching your train or not being late for class (this is the main time you use the "MA" pronunciation)

components: 質 (quality) + 問 (question, problem) = 質問 (question)
description:
a question - usually used in a structured setting: interview, trial, test.　

BOOBOO: in casual conversation, people will say 尋ねる　or 聞く instead of 質問.

components: 問 (question, problem) + 題 (topic) = 問題 (problem)
description: problem - as in "environmental pollution", also as in "homework problem"

components: 疑 (doubt) + 問 (question, problem) = 疑問 (a doubt　)
description: a doubt　（疑問がある＝ I have doubts about it.)

components: 午 (noon) + 前 (before) = 午前 (AM)
description: AM , before noon.

labels: PRE
description: every xxx (day, week, year, night, etc.)
You. Kind of rude -like a father scolding a son. Ruder than 君(きみ) but less rude than コイツ.

meaning: The way one behaves in public
components: 建 (build) + 前 (before) = 建前 (The way one behaves in public)
labels: CCW KUNKUN
description: one's principles, one's public position. (i.e. never drinking tang, being anti-abortion) (as opposed to 本音, one's private feelings)

components: 大 (big) + 切 (cut / important) = 大切 (important)
売 (sell) + 切 (cut / important) = 売り切れ (sold out)
裏 (backside) + 切 (cut / important) = 裏切り (backstab)
description: backstabbing (verb form:　うらぎる！）

components: 裏 (backside) + 切 (cut / important) + 者 (professional) = 裏切り者 (traitor)
labels: KUN ON

components: 一 (one) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 一分 (one minute)
labels: COUNTER
description: one minute of time. (2 minutes = 二分（にふん）、　3 minutes = 三分(三分), etc.)

components: 半 (half) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 半分 (one half)
部 (section) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 部分 (a part or piece. )
気 (mood) + 分 (understand / divide / minute) = 気分 (one's mood)
暴 (rampage) + 力 (strong) = 暴力 (violence)
description: violence of person against person.

components: 努 (make an effort) + 力 (strong) = 努力 (really grueling effort)
協 (cooperate) + 力 (strong) = 協力 (cooperation)
暴力 (violence) + 団 (group) = 暴力団 (the official term for Yakuza. )
labels: NP

meaning: the more polite way to say it.
components: 男 (man) + 人 (person) = 男の人 (the more polite way to say it.)
男 (man) + 子 (child) = 男の子 (boy)
男 (man) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 男性 (male)
男 (man) + 尊 (esteem) + 女 (woman) + 卑 (despicable) = 男尊女卑 (sexism)
description: sexism (literally, and I love this； 'men - esteem - women - despise')

components: 長 (long / boss) + 男 (man) = 長男 (firstborn son)
labels: FP

components: 九 (the number 9) + 時 (time) = 九時 (９ o'clock)
labels: KANA

components: 九 (the number 9) + 月 (moon) = 九月 (September)
labels: KANA

components: 九 (the number 9) + 日 (sun, day) = 九日 (9th day of the month )
labels: FP

components: 日 (sun, day) + 丸 (round) = 日の丸 (the Japanese flag.)
弾 (bullet / play guitar / bounce) + 丸 (round) = 弾丸 (bullet)
小 (small size) + 学校 (school) = 小学校 (elementary school)
小 (small size) + 説 (explain) = 小説 (novel)
小 (small size) + 便 (convenient　/ poop) = 小便 (the wee)
labels: NP
description: the wee (Doctor's word)

components: 小 (small size) + 麦 (barley) + 粉 (powder) = 小麦粉 (flour)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 少 (a little (amount)) + 年 (year) = 少年 (young boy)
description: young boy- usually 5- 15 years old.

components: 少 (a little (amount)) + 数 (integer, to count) = 少数 (minority)
東 (east) + 京 (capital) = 東京 (Tokyo)
東京 (Tokyo) + 都 (major city) = 東京都 (capital city)
description: Tokyo -to. Tokyo is the capital of Japan, so　it has "-to" on the end of it. Most cities have a 市（し） instead. And most prefectures have a 県 (けん） instead. If you think that's confusing, look at Washington DC - it's not a state, but it's not a city. It's a "district." Huh?

components: 京 (capital) + 都 (major city) = 京都 (Kyoto (the former capital!))

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning, 'train line.' In NYC they got the A train, B train, etc. Japanese would call it A線、B線 etc

components: 新 (new) + 幹 (trunk) + 線 (line) = 新幹線 (bullet train)
詳 (expert) + 細 (slender) = 詳細 (details)
description: the details or particulars of a thing

components: 細 (slender) + 胞 (cell) = 細胞 (cell)
description: a cell, like an amoeba or a brain cell.

small, in the sense of petty or trifling, insignificant. Don't sweat the small stuff. Don't bother me with such trivial complaints. Here's a good phrase to learn: "些細な事に気を使うな！”　（ささいなことにきをつかうな）= Don't worry about such trivial things!

components: 関 (connected to) + 係 (be involved with) = 関係 (related to)
description: related to - a sysadmin job is コンピュータ関係

components: 用 (utilize) + 事 (action/ incident) = 用事 (errands)
description: errands, chores, stuff to do. "I'd love to come to see your performance piece, buttttt I've got 用事。”

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning, only XXX can use this water fountain.

components: 用 (utilize) + 意 (meaning) = 用意 (get set！！)
description: 'get set' - basically it means the same as 準備 , but the nuance is a bit more abstract. : If you’re getting prepared mentally , that’s 準備(じゅんび） . If you’re arranging stuff over the phone, use 用意 . The ‘Get set!’ in ‘Get ready! Get set! Go!’ is 用意 .

components: 利 (handy) + 用 (utilize) = 利用 (utilize)
description: to utilize. Usually used in the sense of, 'Only students/Japanese/Scientologists can utilize this swimming pool.'

components: 千 (thousand) + 円 (yen/circle) + 札 (card / label / bill) = 千円札 (1,000 yen bill)
labels: COUNTER
description: any money in paper form is a 'satsu' - a ten dollar bill is a $10 satsu, etc.

components: 猫 (cat) + 舌 (tongue) = 猫舌 (no hot food for me!)
labels: KUNKUN
description: someone who doesn't like hot (like oven-hot, not spicy) food.

components: 毒 (poison/ addict) + 舌 (tongue) = 毒舌 (sharp-tongued)
description: 'poison tongue' - in English, we'd say a sharp tongue

components: 電 (electricity) + 話 (conversation) = 電話 (telephone)
会 (big meeting) + 話 (conversation) = 会話 (conversation)
英 (heroic) + 会話 (conversation) = 英会話 (English conversation school)
description: an English conversation school where nobody learns. Also, a place for housewives to meet shameless Australians.

components: 話 (conversation) + 題 (topic) = 話題 (theme)
description: a theme (of a book or show) topic (of conversation)

components: 生 (life / birth) + 活 (vivid, lively) = 生活 (lifestyle)
活 (vivid, lively) + 動 (movement) = 活動 (activity )
description: activity - like 'Gang activity has increased in this area,' or, 'Her band's been really active this year,' etc.

components: 活 (vivid, lively) + 躍 (jump) = 活躍 (active career)
description: used in business or showbiz - to be doing a lot of things which are getting the notice of one's peer group. To suceed in making a name for one's self. To be going places. .

components: 辞 (quit) + 書 (write) = 辞書 (dictionary)
世 (society) + 辞 (quit) = 世辞 (flattery)
時 (time) + 半 (half) = 2時半 (2:30)
半 (half) + 年 (year) = 半年 (half a year.)

components: 半 (half) + 額 (amount of money / forehead) = 半額 (half-price)
description: half-price, half the amount.

components: 平 (equal / level) + 気 (mood) = 平気 (ok?)
labels: KIDS
description: it's ok with me. Usually phrased as a question, as in, 平気？ "Is that ok with you?" This is only used by young people - more often young women.

components: 平 (equal / level) + 和 (peace/ Japan) = 平和 (peace)
平 (equal / level) + 日 (sun, day) = 平日 (weekday)

meaning: fairness (opp. 不公平:ふこうへい)
components: 公 (public) + 平 (equal / level) = 公平 (fairness (opp. 不公平:ふこうへい))
平 (equal / level) + 等 (equal /etc./plural) = 平等 (impartial, even)
labels: FP
description: impartial, even-steven. (to cut the cake into equal pieces, to treat your adopted kids and your biological kids equally)

components: 土 (earth) + 曜日 (day of week) = 土曜日 (Saturday)
labels: KUN ON

components: 土 (earth) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) = お土産 (souvenir )
labels: FP 1/2 KANA

components: 黒 (black) + 人 (person) = 黒人 (Black person)
labels: NEO

components: 兵 (soldier) + 士 (samurai radical) = 兵士 (infantryman, low-ranking soldier)
武 (military) + 士 (samurai radical) = 武士 (samurai)
description: White kids say 'samurai', but real Japanese usually say ぶし. It can also be used to refer to the whole social class, as in　武士精神 （ぶしせいしん = samruai spirit) or　武士道 （ぶしどう = the honor-code of the samurai)

components: 力 (strong) + 士 (samurai radical) = 力士 (Sumo rassler)
labels: FP

components: 消 (erase) + 防 (ward off) + 士 (samurai radical) = 消防士 (firefighter)
仕 (work) + 事 (action/ incident) = 仕事 (one's job, one's work. )
labels: KUN ON

components: 結 (bind) + 局 (department) = 結局 (in the end, or "after all")
結 (bind) + 婚 (marriage) = 結婚 (to marry)
description: to marry (to be married to xxx-san = ｘｘｘさん　に　結婚　してる）

components: 結 (bind) + 果 (fruit　/ result) = 結果 (result)
結 (bind) + 構 (set up / care about) = 結構 (ok / no thanks / very)
labels: JERK 1/2 KANA
description:
this has 3 meanings, each used just as often as the others .

1)literally, "OK."

2) "No thank you" (just like American women, Japanese people use 'That's ok' to mean 'No.'!)

3) "Very much" : You often hear people saying, "Kekkou atsui ne!" ("It's very hot today, eh?")

components: 雑 (miscellaneous , random) + 誌 (magazine) = 雑誌 (magazine)
老 (get old) + 人 (person) = 老人 (old person.Not rude.)

labels: KANA

components: 競 (contest) + 馬 (horse) = 競馬 (horse racing)
labels: FP

components: 中 (middle) + 止 (stop) = 中止 (stop/cancel)
labels: NP
description: (temporarily) stopped or (permanently) canceled. This is a word you'd hear in an announcement. You wouldn't say to your friend, "I'm going to 中止 watching TV for a week."

components: 痛 (hurts!!!) + 止 (stop) = 痛み止め (pain-killer,)
description: pain-killer, like aspirin. (BOOBOO: not anaesthetic, which is 麻酔（ますい） )

components: 歩 (walk) + 道 (street) = 歩道 (sidewalk)
散 (scatter) + 歩 (walk) = 散歩 (a stroll)
description: a stroll, to walk with no particular destination

components: 歩 (walk) + 行 (go) + 者 (professional) = 歩行者 (pedestrian)
満 (full) + 足 (foot/ be enough) = 満足 (to be totally satisfied.)
足 (foot/ be enough) + 首 (neck) = 足首 (ankle)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 正 (correct) + 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) = 正直 (honest / loyal)
description: very honest person, very loyal. Person with integrity. Also means, "To tell you the truth. . . xxxx"

components: 正 (correct) + 解 (solve / untie) = 正解 (correct answer)
正 (correct) + 確 (make certain) = 正確 (precise)
description: accurate, precise (used about machines, not people)

components: 予 (beforehand) + 定 (plan) = 予定 (an informal plan)
description: an informal plan (like to meet your friends for a movie)

components: 設 (establish) + 定 (plan) = 設定 (establish)
description: to establish a regulation or rule - also it is often seen on the 'setup' or 'preferences' menus of software when you install it.

components: 決 (decide) + 定 (plan) = 決定 (make a serious decision)
description: to make a real serious decision； like, "I know I'm always saying I'm going to lose 1２ pounds but this time I really mean it."

components: 定 (plan) + 義 (righteousness) = 定義 (definition)
description: a definition (hey! recursion!)

components: 暴 (rampage) + 走 (run) + 族 (family) = 暴走族 (Japanese bikers. )
競 (contest) + 走 (run) = 競走 (race)
description: the more literal word for race: racing cars, sprinting, marathons, etc.

components: 駅 (train station) + 員 (clerk) = 駅員 (train station staff. )
昼 (noon) + 寝 (go to bed) = 昼寝 (a nap)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 昼 (noon) + 休 (rest) = 昼休み (lunch-break )
description: lunch-break (at work, school, etc.)

components: 沢 (swamp / bling) + 山 (mountain) = 沢山 (hell of many. )
labels: KANA
1/2 KANA
description: extravagant (luxurious in a bad way)

components: 勝 (win) + 手 (hand) = 勝手 (to do without asking)
labels: KUNKUN
description: to do like a dick. I mean, to do something selfishly without asking, like you're the only one on the planet. I ate MY cake, but then I かってに ate your cake too, and just look at you like, "What?" (****)

components: 相 (partner) + 手 (hand) = 相手 (partner)
labels: KUNKUN
description: one's partner (in conversation, tennis, or anything else however temporary)

components: 片 (fragment) + 手 (hand) = 片手 (one-handed)
labels: KUNKUN
description: to do xxx one-handed.

components: 手 (hand) + 作 (make) = 手作り (handmade)
labels: NEO
KUNKUN

components: 耳 (ear) + 遠 (far) = 耳が遠い (hard of hearing)
耳 (ear) + 鳴 (animal cry) = 耳鳴り (tinnitus)
取 (take) + 替 (substitute) = 取り替える (to exchange)

meaning: to cancel an order, to withdraw.
components: 取 (take) + 消 (erase) = 取り消す (to cancel an order, to withdraw. )
取 (take) + 扱 (treatment) = 取り扱い (management)
description: Treatment - but unlike 扱う, 取り扱う is ONLY used for objects or cases. i.e. The police are handling the racial hate-crime very carefully.

components: 取 (take) + 締 (tighten) = 取り締まり (crackdown)
description: a crackdown, a regulation of something that was unregulated

components: 最 (most) + 高 (tall) = 最高 (the best)
最 (most) + 初 (first time) = 最初 (first of all. . .)
最 (most) + 後 (afterwards / behind) = 最後 (last)
最 (most) + 近 (near) = 最近 (recently)
最 (most) + 悪 (bad) = 最悪 (the worst XXX EVAR.)
最 (most) + 低 (low) = 最低 (lowest, worst)
description: the lowest - both in the moral sense of "He's the lowest kind of sexual predator" and in the mathematical sense of "Crime rates are the lowest in 30 years," or "Do this for a minimum of 5 minutes per day."

components: 最 (most) + 初 (first time) = 最初の (at first)
新 (new) + 聞 (listen/ ask) = 新聞 (newspaper )
盗 (steal by stealth) + 聞 (listen/ ask) = 盗み聞き (to eavesdrop)
竹 (bamboo) + 子 (child) = 竹の子 (bamboo shoot)
description: a bamboo shoot, also a famous harajuku fashion shop

components: 作 (make) + 家 (home) = 作家： (author)
作 (make) + 戦 (fight) = 作戦 (strategy)
description: any strategy for succeeding － in war, business, school, etc.

components: 近 (near) + 寄 (get close) = 近寄る (get close to)
description: to get close to, to approach.(usually used in the negative, on warning signs: danger! keep out! danger! high voltage! 近寄るな!)

components: 近 (near) + 所 (area / attribute) = 近所 (around here)
description: in this neighborhood, around here- (BOOBOO: 近所 is strictly relative to where you are standing at the time. You can't say 'Shibuya is a neighborhood in tokyo,' - in that case, you have to use MACHI(町)。)

components: 近 (near) + 付 (stick to) = 近付く (get close to destination)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: to draw close to a physical destination or a goal.

components: 木 (tree) + 曜日 (day of week) = 木曜日 (Thursday )
labels: KUN ON

components: 木 (tree) + 造 (produce) = 木造 (wooden)
木 (tree) + 製 (mass production) = 木製 (made from wood. )
雨 (rain) + 林 (grove) = 雨林 (rain forest)
labels: NEO

components: 森 (forest) + 林 (grove) = 森林 (forests)
description: forests in general. (forest ecology, forest creatures, forestry)

components: 本 (book / the real) + 当 (hit the target) = 本当 (for realz.)

labels: COUNTER
description:
used for counting. Ippon is one book. Psyche! ISSATSU (一冊) is one book, ippon is one cylindrical object. Makes sense if you imagine that back when Chinese sages were inventing kanji, books were written on scrolls and shit。

Pronounced like this: 1: いっぽん、２： にほん、　３：　さんぼん、　etc.

components: 本 (book / the real) + 音 (sound) = 本音 (one's real feelings)
labels: CCW FP
description: one's real feelings, as opposed to 建前　（たてまえ）. You know, the 2 faces that only Japanese people have, as if no one else in the world would dream of being so false, and all that bullshit.

meaning: the real thing, not a counterfeit.
components: 本 (book / the real) + 物 (animal / thing) = 本物 (the real thing, not a counterfeit.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 本 (book / the real) + 来 (come/future) = 本来 (originally)
description: originally, essentially , primairlyー Emphasizes the historical roots. Originally the EPA was supposed to protect the environment, but nowadays it's protecting the polluters!

components: 液 (liquid) + 体 (body) = 液体 (liquid)
具 (tool) + 体 (body) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 具体的 (concrete/ in practice)
description: concrete, literal, in practice . . as opposed to abstract, in theory

components: 死 (death) + 体 (body) = 死体 (corpse)
体 (body) + 重 (heavy / overlap) = 体重 (your mama's weight (450kilos?))
全 (all) + 体 (body) = 全体 (entire,the whole thing.)
体 (body) + 育 (grow up / be raised) = 体育 (P.E. class)

description: Good night! (BOOBOO: You don't say this when you leave your friend's dinner party or when you leave your date standing on the curb weeping outside the restaurant, you only say it when you live in the same house: it's more like "sleep tight!", I guess.)

components: 夏 (summer) + 休 (rest) = 夏休み (summer vacation)
冬 (winter) + 休 (rest) = 冬休み (winter break. )
休 (rest) + 日 (sun, day) = 休日 (A holiday)
description: A holiday - Christmas, Arbor Day, etc.

components: 新 (new) + 宿 (lodge at) + 区 (ward) = 新宿区 (Shinjuku ward)
新 (new) + 鮮 (fresh) = 新鮮 (f-f-f-f-f-f-f-f-f-f-f-f-ffffffreshhhhh!)
東 (east) + 口 (mouth) = 東口 (east exit)
関 (connected to) + 東 (east) = 関東 (East Japan)
description: east side of Japan ー including Tokyo.

components: 中 (middle) + 東 (east) = 中東 (the middle-east.)
labels: NEO

components: 複 (complicated or compound) + 雑 (miscellaneous , random) = 複雑 (complicated)
description: complicated; having multiple things that make it complex.

components: 雑 (miscellaneous , random) + 音 (sound) = 雑音 (noise)
description: noise - like traffic, static, the classic STORMTROOPERS OF DEATH song 'What's that noise?!?!?' etc.

components: 和 (peace/ Japan) + 風 (wind / the flu / style) = 和風 (Japanese-style)
description: Japanese-style (food, clothing, houses. . .)

components: 和 (peace/ Japan) + 食 (eat) = 和食 (Japanese-style food)
私 (me / private) + 達 (plural/delivery) = 私達 (us)
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 私 (me / private) + 鉄 (iron) = 私鉄 (private railway)
description: private railway - uses the second meaning of '私’ (private)

components: 委 (member) + 員 (clerk) = 委員 (member of a committee.)
週 (week) + 末 (the tip) = 週末 (the weekend)
年 (year) + 末 (the tip) = 年末 (end of the year)
月 (moon) + 末 (the tip) = 月末 (end of the month)
結 (bind) + 末 (the tip) = 結末 (conclusion)
description: the conclusion of something - the last chapter of a book or the last scene of a movie.

components: 意 (meaning) + 味 (flavor) = 意味 (meaning)
興 (interest) + 味 (flavor) = 興味 (interest)
description:
interest in something

興味のあるｘｘｘ : an intriguing xxx

きょうみがある : I'm interested in it!

興味無し！ : I'm not interested!

components: 趣 (hobby) + 味 (flavor) = 趣味 (hobby)
中 (middle) + 米 (rice / America) = 中米 (Latin America)
labels: NEO

components: 欧 (Europe) + 米 (rice / America) = 欧米 (europe/ USA)
description: Europe and USA - but unfortunately due to racism, Japanese often use 欧米 to mean the West in general, ignoring Africa, South and Latin America and even Canada.

components: 南 (south) + 米 (rice / America) = 南米 (South America)
labels: NEO

components: 玄 (deep profound) + 米 (rice / America) = 玄米 (brown rice)
粘 (be sticky) + 土 (earth) = 粘土 (clay)
description: clay. (BOOBOO : but not the finished pottery, which is '陶器', or 'とうき')

components: 粘 (be sticky) + 着 (wear / arrive) = 粘着 (adhesive)
description: adhesive- like tape, glue, or maybe even velcro?

components: 来 (come/future) + 年 (year) = 来年 (next year)
出 (pull out / hand over) + 来 (come/future) = 出来る (possible)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: it's possible to do.(I can run, I can shit, but I can't run and shit at the same time.)

components: 以 (compared to) + 来 (come/future) = 以来 (since then)
labels: NP

description: a specific person's future (i.e. the dumb interview question, "What do you see yourself doing 10 years from now?") Also sometimes used with Japan's future.

components: 番 (number) + 号 (ID number) = 番号 (number)
description: number which has been assigned to a thing, as in phone number or apartment number, or ZIP code number.

components: 交 (combine) + 番 (number) = 交番 (police box)
description: police box - a small shop in your neighborhood where police hang out and wait to help you or jail you.

components: 大 (big) + 変 (change) = 大変 (that's terrible!)
description:
this has 2 meanings, both used equally often:

"Tony is tai hen!" , for instance, could mean:

a) I feel sorry for Tony because his job sucks and his girl is cheating.

b) Tony is a really scary, mean person.

components: 大 (big) + 事 (action/ incident) = 大事 (vital)
description: vital, important. Can also be used as a sort of goodbye - but only in cases where you're sort of worried about the person. Like if they're coming down with a cold, you'd say, "お大事に！”　instead of ”またね！”

components: 大 (big) + 家 (home) = 大家 (landlord)
labels: FP

components: 大 (big) + 型 (type / proper way) = 大型 (large-scale )
labels: KUNKUN

components: 中 (middle) + 央 (central) = 中央 (central)
description: central. Tokyo has a famous train line: 中央線、(the central line).

components: 映 (project, reflect) + 画 (a drawing) = 映画 (movie)
映画 (movie) + 館 (big hall) = 映画館 (movie theater)
映 (project, reflect) + 像 (statue / image) = 映像 (image)
description: any reflected, moving image - including images on TV or a computer screen, a shadow play, etc.

components: 子 (child) + 犬 (dog) = 子犬 (puppy)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 負 (lose) + 犬 (dog) = 負け犬 (loser)
description: Since it literally means 'losing dog,' you'd think that was a transliteration of the English 'underdog,' But no, it simply means loser or schlemiel. Japan doesn't really have much respect for plucky underdogs who dare to try and rise above their status.

components: 全 (all) + 然 (nature) = 全然 (absolutely! )
labels: 1/2 KANA
description:
absolutely! (usually used to emphasize the word after it. But sometimes, the word being emphasized is omitted because it's so obvious (to Japanese))

If you hear someone say 'Zenzen!' with no word after it, it might mean 'zenzen daijoubu,' ('Absolutely no problemo.') . . .

OR it might mean 'zen zen dame!' ('No effing way, guy!')

components: 自 (my own) + 然 (nature) = 自然 (nature)
当 (hit the target) + 然 (nature) = 当然 (natural, obvious)
description: just, natural, deserved - although it's often used like 'That's obvious, isn't it?'

components: 太 (fat) + 平 (equal / level) + 洋 (Pacific Ocean / the West) = 太平洋 (the Pacific Ocean)
太 (fat) + 鼓 (drum) = 太鼓 (Japanese drums)
description: traditional Japanese drums - the kind that can be up to 15 feet wide. (BOOBOO: Rock and roll drums are just called ドラム.)

components: 今 (now) + 回 (rotate / times) = 今回 (this time)
毎 (every) + 回 (rotate / times) = 毎回 (every time)
description: every time. Every single fucking time. Jesus! Get it together, man. Sometimes I don't know what goes on in your head.

components: 一 (one) + 回 (rotate / times) = 一回 (one time)
labels: COUNTER

components: 前 (before) + 回 (rotate / times) = 前回 (last time)
description: last time (last time, this happened, last time we met). although in practice people tend to use the more irritating and ambiguous 'この 前.' (back then)

components: 井 (well) + 戸 (door) = 井戸 (a well)
labels: FP

components: 天 (heaven) + 井 (well) = 天井 (ceiling)
labels: KUNKUN
SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning ‘bowl of hot rice and sweet sauce with a painfully stingy amount of XXXX on top' (XXX is usually beef or pork)

components: 牛 (cow) + 丼 (beef bowl) = 牛丼 (beef bowl)
description: beef bowl (beef over rice).

components: 女 (woman) + 王様 (king) = 女王様 (queen)
王 (king) + 様 (important person) = 王様 (king)
法 (law) + 王 (king) = 法王 (the fuckin' Pope)
金 (gold) + 玉 (ball) = 金玉 (balls)
labels: KUN ON
description: your mama's big hairy balls

components: 玉 (ball) + 子 (child) = 玉子 (Egg.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 目 (eye) + 玉 (ball) = 目玉 (the eyeball)
labels: KUNKUN NEO

components: 中 (middle) + 国 (country) = 中国 (China)
description: China (think, 'the Middle Kingdom')

components: 国 (country) + 際 (edge) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 国際的 (international)
description: international. As in a certain House of Pancakes (also used to refer to a couple where one person is a foreigner: こくさいてきな カップル.)

components: 国 (country) + 民 (folk) = 国民 (people of a country)
description: the people, as in, "The Republicans are the People's party!"

components: 天 (heaven) + 国 (country) = 天国 (heaven)
全 (all) + 国 (country) = 全国 (nationwide)
description: nationwide,national (as in a national contest)

components: 理 (reason) + 由 (freedom / reason) = 理由 (reason)
description: reason (for doing something)

components: 理 (reason) + 解 (solve / untie) = 理解 (comprehend, understand.)
心 (heart) + 理 (reason) + 学 (knowledge) = 心理学 (psychology)
地 (area) + 理 (reason) = 地理 (geography)
主 (master/mainly) + 語 (language) = 主語 (subject)
description: the subject of the sentence. AKA the thing Japanese people never say.

components: 主 (master/mainly) + 義 (righteousness) = 主義 (- ism)
labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning 'ism'. As in capitalism, communism, materialism, and a Japanese grindcore band called 'intestine baalism.'

components: 共 (with) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) + 主義 (- ism) = 共産主義 (communism)
無 (without) + 政府 (government) + 主義 (- ism) = 無政府主義 (@narchy)
民 (folk) + 主 (master/mainly) + 主義 (- ism) = 民主主義 (democracy )
資本 (capital) + 主義 (- ism) = 資本主義 (capitalism)
飼 (keep a pet) + 主 (master/mainly) = 飼い主 (pet owner)
封 (seal in) + 建 (build) + 主義 (- ism) = 封建主義 (feudalism)
主 (master/mainly) + 題 (topic) + 歌 (sing) = 主題歌 (theme song)
住 (dwell) + 所 (area / attribute) = 住所 (address)
住 (dwell) + 民 (folk) = 住民 (residents)
原 (original/ high plain) + 住民 (residents) = 原住民 (native)
description: a person or animal native to the area. Indigenous.

components: 青 (blue) + 信号 (signal) = 青信号 (green light!)
description: a blue traffic light - in English we call it a "green traffic light." (BOOBOO: In Japan, they call the same blue-greenish color '青い' - so it isn't exactly the English "Green."

meaning: in the prime of one's life.
components: 青 (blue) + 春 (spring /sexy) = 青春 (in the prime of one's life.)
素 (element) + 晴 (weather get good now) = 素晴らしい (the best!)
labels: FP
description: the best! Usually used about art or theatrical performances.

components: 先 (earlier/ the tip) + 生 (life / birth) = 先生 (teacher)
学 (knowledge) + 生 (life / birth) = 学生 (student)

labels: PRE
description: this is hard. It got tons of meanings: nama tv is live, not prerecorded. Nama beer is poured straight from the bottle, not like a fancy mixed drink. Nama information is first hand. Nama meat is raw.

components: 生 (life / birth) + 物 (animal / thing) = 生き物 (living thing)
description: living, moving thing . . . (BOOBOO：it doesn't apply to plants! Only little dudes that can move around and forage for food are いきもの)

components: 惑 (be misguided or tempted) + 星 (star) = 惑星 (planet.)
衛 (defense) + 星 (star) = 衛星 (satellite)
図 (diagram/ map) + 星 (star) = 図星 (bullseye.)

components: 乙 (second rank / girl) + 女 (woman) = 乙女 (pure, virginal girl)

description: a girl. Unlike the related term 少女,　乙女 emphasizes the "pure, virginal" aspect of girlhood - used about girls around 12-19 years old.

labels: KIDS

components: 母 (your Moms) + 親 (parents/kindness) = 母親 (Mother)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 父 (dad) + 母 (your Moms) = 父母 (mama-papa )

components: 毎 (every) + 晩 (night) = 毎晩 (every night)
海 (ocean) + 岸 (shore) = 海岸 (coast / beach)
description: the coast OR the beach! Unlike 浜辺 or 浜, 海岸 has a scientific meaning: the coastline, (regardless of if there's sand or not). You'll see 海岸 on maps or geography books. The useage of 海岸 is odd, even for Japanese. Where Americans will just say, "Let's go to the beach!", Japanese might suggest to their pals, "海へ行こう！”（let's go to the ocean!) but ONLY ONCE THEY WERE ALREADY THERE, then they might specifically suggest going to the 海岸 - as opposed to other things to do by the sea. Weird!

components: 海 (ocean) + 外 (outside) = 海外 (foreign countries)
description: accross the sea - foreign countries, basically.

components: 海 (ocean) + 軍 (army) = 海軍 (navy)
description: in the kaiiiigun, you can sail the seven seeeeas, in the kaiiiigun, you can put yourself at eeeeease...

components: 海 (ocean) + 底 (bottom) = 海底 (bottom of the ocean)
世 (society) + 中 (middle) = 世の中 (the world)
description: the social, everyday world - more poetic than 世界。 Used in dramatic declarations like, "I'm sick of this fuckin' world!" "I don't care about this life!" "Poor Kurt Cobain, he was just too sensitive for this cruel world!" Also, usually implies JUST Japanese society.

components: 真 (really) + 中 (middle) = 真ん中 (the very center)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 中 (middle) + 学校 (school) = 中学校 (middle school)
中 (middle) + 級 (level) = 中級 (intermediate-level)

in the middle of doing XXX.

XXX is always a noun: 電話中　（電話中）means 'I'm on the phone right now!'

components: マ () + 毛 (fur) = マン毛 (ladies' pubicals)

見 (look) + 付 (stick to) = 見付ける (find)

components: 親 (parents/kindness) + 切 (cut / important) = 親切 (kind)

components: 西 (west) + 側 (side of something) = 西側 (west siiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiide.)

components: 金 (gold) + 魚 (fish) = 金魚 (goldfish)
四 (the numeral 4) + 角 (horn/corner) = 四角 (a square)

売 (sell) + 春 (spring /sexy) + 婦 (housewife / lady) = 売春婦 (hoe)
description: your sister　(when your brother when he runs out of meth money, he turns into a `売春男') !!

components: 訓 (kunyomi) + 読 (read) = 訓読み (yep yep.)
購 (subscribe) + 読 (read) = 購読 (to subscribe)
道 (street) + 具 (tool) = 道具 (tool)
家 (home) + 具 (tool) = 家具 (furniture)
具 (tool) + 合 (to suit) = 具合 (condition)
labels: KUN ON NOKURI
description: condition something is in. Can be used with a living thing or object. Always used only with いい or 悪い. Unlike the related term 調子（ちょうし）,具合 emphasizes the condition IN THE SHORT TERM - the condition at that particular time of day.

components: 元 (original) + 気 (mood) = 元気 (cheerful)
labels: CCW
description: cheerful, energetic. Doesn't matter if it's totally forced.

labels: PRE

components: 足 (foot/ be enough) + 元 (original) = 足元 (at your feet)

description: right at your feet, right in front of you. often seen on 'watch your step!' signs)

才 (skill / age) + 能 (talent) = 才能 (talent)

components: 財 (loot) + 布 (fabric) = 財布 (wallet)

components: 財 (loot) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) = 財産 (one's possessions)
財 (loot) + 閥 (clique) = 財閥 (big biz)
description: a group of banks, corporations, and underworld guys, where everyone is on each other's board of directors - like capitalist feudal states. These are the fuckers who bankrolled and encouraged Japan's role in the second world war. FDR specifically told MacArthur to break them up, but Mac didn't.Companies like Mitsui bank and Mitsubishi, Nissan, etc. have profited handsomely off of slave labor and Hirohito's war, and they continue to be the bedrock of society.

components: 閉 (close store) + 店 (shop) = 閉店 (close store)
description: close the store for the day (although people usually say 終わる instead!)

components: 観 (point of view) + 光 (shining) + 客 (customer) = 観光客 (tourist)
光 (shining) + 景 (scene) = 光景 (a spectacle)
光 (shining) + 栄 (glory) = 光栄 (it's an honor!)
labels: F
description: honor : usually used by lower person to higher person. "It's an honor to meet you, sir!" "I'm honored to have a chance to work with you, ma'am."

components: 簡 (simplicity) + 単 (merely) = 簡単 (simple)
description: simple or easy, but in a good way

components: 単 (merely) + 語 (language) = 単語 (simple word)
description: a SIMPLE Japanese word (note the 単 kanji) : 犬 is a tango, as is a hiragana word like いや. But compound words or long-ass words are not tango.

components: 単 (merely) + 位 (rank) = 単位 (unit)
description: denomination or unit (college credit, but also centimeter or pound)

components: 単 (merely) + 純 (epitome) = 単純 (simple version)
description: the simple kind of X as opposed to the complicated kind (not rude). Also, simple-minded, mouth-breathing person (pretty rude).

components: 受 (receive) + 付 (stick to) = 受付 (reception)
labels: NOKURI
description: the reception desk in an office.

components: 受 (receive) + 領 (territory) + 書 (write) = 受領書 (reciept)
観 (point of view) + 客 (customer) = 観客 (audience)
乗 (ride a vehicle) + 客 (customer) = 乗客 (passenger)
labels: NP

components: 適 (suitable) + 当 (hit the target) = 適当 (appropriate)
labels: JERK
description: appropriate, as in an appropriate gift. However, 適当　also means irresponsible! Doing something without considering the consequences. 適当な人間だ！ “He's irresponsible. He'll say anything that pops into his head.”

components: 当 (hit the target) + 日 (sun, day) = 当日 (that day . . .)

components: 大 (big) + 工 (craft or industry) = 大工 (carpenter)

description: carpenter. How awesome is that!???! Seriously, I wouldn't even believe my friend when he told me,I was like, 'Cmon, grow up.' He was like, "What is so funny about a daiku carpenter?" I made him look it up in the dictionary and prove it.

components: 空 (air) + 気 (mood) = 空気 (air )
空 (air) + 港 (harbor) = 空港 (airport )
写 (copy) + 真 (really) = 写真 (photo)

暗 (dark) + 証 (proof) + 番号 (number) = 暗証番号 (secret code number)
description: your secret PIN number you use when you go to the ATM. This is different from a password you use on the internet - that's パスワード。

components: 考 (consider) + 慮 (consideration) = 考慮 (consider)
labels: NP
description: to take into account the special circumstances (i.e. before you punish him for vandalism, remember to take into account that his dad just died).

components: 代 (generation / instead of) + 表 (express) = 代表 (representative)

components: 世 (society) + 代 (generation / instead of) = 世代 (generation)
description: a generation (as in, generation gap, the me generation, all that stuff)

description: A machine, particularly something with a motor in it which moves when activated. A computer is not a 機械 , but a robot arm is.

description: a chance, as in, "I hope I will have a chance to go to Australia someday." or "This could be my only chance to see yo mama's huge collection of Rosie O'donnel pap-smears."

labels: SUF
description:
SUFFIX meaning 'ward'- for example,

新宿区 (しんじゅくく) Shinjuku ward. (ward is a district of a city)

description: to make a distinction - to tell one thing from another - 2 synonyms, for instance. or 2 similar-looking kanji

description: the government office for your ward- where you get your immigration paperwork and junk.

description: 4 hours' time. As in, this bus ride takes 4 hours.

description: singer. Not like Joey Ramone, but like Celine Fuckin' Dion or Pavarotti or someone.

教 (teach) + 室 (room suffix) = 教室 (classroom)
教 (teach) + 育 (grow up / be raised) = 教育 (education)

components: 改 (renew / improve) + 造 (produce) = 改造 (remodeling, renewal)

components: 日 (sun, day) + 記 (diary) = 日記 (diary)
記 (diary) + 者 (professional) = 記者 (reporter)
description: reporter

description: a memorial, an anniversary of something good , like marriage or a band's anniversary gig. Or something you give your friend to remember you by.

description: origin or cause of something

labels: NEO
description: the A-bomb　(a contraction of 原子爆弾 (げんしばくだん))

components: 反 (anti) + 対 (against) = 反対 (against it!!!!!!!!!!)

components: 反 (anti) + 則 (rule) = 反則 (foul! To break a rule!)
反 (anti) + 抗 (oppose) = 反抗 (rebel)
description: to be rebellious, defiant. To start a revolt. Unlike the related words 抵抗　（ていこう）　and 対抗　（たいこう）、　反抗 has the nuance of 'rebel for the fuck of it,' like a teenager would.

components: 反 (anti) + 応 (react) = 反応 (a reaction )
labels: FP
description: a reaction - despite the 反 kanji, 反応 is not neccesairly a bad reaction. As a noun, it's value-free. (careful! This is pronounced NOU, not OU)

description: A noun meaning, "the act of going downhill." Unhelpfully, this is not used as a verb. What the hell, man?

components: 上 (above) + 坂 (slope) = 上り坂 (go uphill )
description: "the act of going uphill." Same deal.

components: 完 (complete) + 成 (become) = 完成 (completion)
description: completion (noun) - usually said of a painting, construction of a building, or other physically creative project.

components: 成 (become) + 功 (success) = 成功 (success)
成 (become) + 程 (extent) = 成程 (oh, I see!)
labels: KANA KUNKUN
description: "ohhhh, now I see!" (very similar to a hearty 分かった！！　（わかった）, but it also has the nuance of, understanding AND agreeing whole-heartedly)

labels: COUNTER
description: counter for "years old" that a person is.

components: 気 (mood) + 付 (stick to) = 気を付けて (be careful!)
気 (mood) + 持 (hold) = 気持ち (feels good!)
description: oh HELLS yeah. It feels good.(although this isn't dirty by itself, it is the #1 actual word yelled in pornos.)

components: 天 (heaven) + 気 (mood) = 天気 (weather)
気 (mood) + 違 (different and therefore wrong) = 気違い (fuckin' crazy)
labels: ABU
description:
(literally, 'different feeling') crazy - this is one of the biggest cusses in the whole language-a garunteed fight-starter. This is instructive in several ways.

1) Japanese is such a polite language that 'different feeling' is one of the worst insults.

2) it takes a certain kind of culture to think that having a different feeling is such a bad thing in the first place!

3) Historically it is a discriminatory term against people who suffer from mental illness.

components: 気 (mood) + 付 (stick to) = 気付いた (realize something)
description: to belatedly realize something - d'oh! (also pronounced 気がついた）

components: 気 (mood) + 晴 (weather get good now) = 気晴らし (Just for fun)
description: Just for fun, do you wanna (blah blah blah)?"

components: 同 (same) + 時 (time) = 同時 (at the same time)
同 (same) + 様 (important person) = 同様 (in the same way)
description: in the same way. For example, "In the same way caffeine perks up the mind, your dad's naked pictures perk up the body."

components: 遠 (far) + 慮 (consideration) = 遠慮 (regretfully decline or enjoin from)
labels: CCW F
description:
CULTURAL CODE WORD in full effect. Meaning, it's such a uniquely Japanese concept there is no ready English equivalent.

遠慮 means to be diplomatically, politely refuse, to regretfully decline.

For example, "You want the last donut?" "Hell yes!" is not 遠慮.

But, "No way I don't want it, it smells!" is also not 遠慮 .

"Thanks but I'm full now." is the 遠慮 answer, since it means, "We both know I want it, but since I abstained from it, you owe me one, now! The favor-ball is back in my court!"

Used most commonly in two situations：

1) 遠慮せず： meaning, 'Act casual. Eat the last pie. Don't wait for all the food to be served. Sit wherever. Make yourself at home.'

2) it's often seen on signs telling you not to do something: XXX遠慮してください。 ('Please refrain from doing XXX')

components: 動物 (animal) + 園 (public park) = 動物園 (zoo)
遊 (play around) + 園 (public park) + 地 (area) = 遊園地 (amusement park)

良 (good) + 心 (heart) = 良心 (conscience)
病 (sick kanji) + 院 (institution) = 病院 (hospital)
美 (beauty) + 容 (appearance) + 院 (institution) = 美容院 (beauty salon.)
description: beauty salon. Yes, hospital （びょういん） and beauty salon (びよういん） DO sound totally alike.This is one of the basic mindfucks that teachers like to spring on newbies, so act like you know.

labels: COUNTER
description: SUFFIX. For example, ２倍 means, double the amount. 3倍 means triple the amount, etc.

components: 寝 (go to bed) + 不足 (shortage of) = 寝不足 (lack of sleep )

components: 寝 (go to bed) + 坊 (boy / monk) = 寝坊 (sleep late, oversleep)
labels: KUN ON

components: 寝 (go to bed) + 室 (room suffix) = 寝室 (bedroom)
北 (north) + 口 (mouth) = 北口 (north exit)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 北 (north) + 海 (ocean) + 道 (street) = 北海道 (Hokkaido)

labels: KUN ON

components: 先 (earlier/ the tip) + 週 (week) = 先週 (last week)
先 (earlier/ the tip) + 年 (year) = 先年 (not last year.)
description: last year. PSYCHE。 you didn't think it would be that logical? last year is 去年：きょねん.

components: 面倒 (trouble, petty bullshit) + 臭 (stinky and dumb xxx!) = 面倒臭い (pain in the ass)

components: 面 (front surface / face) + 目 (eye) + 保 (guarantee/maintain ) = 面目を保つ (save face)

components: 宿 (lodge at) + 題 (topic) = 宿題 (homework)

labels: KANA

components: 石 (rock) + 油 (oil) = 石油 (petroleum oil.)

components: 山 (mountain) + 登 (climb) = 山登り (mountain climbing)

components: 焼 (roast / grill) + 鳥 (bird) = 焼鳥 (roast chicken)

components: 鳥 (bird) + 肌 (human skin) = 鳥肌 (goosebumps)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 広 (wide) + 島 (island) = 広島 (Hiroshima.)
labels: KUNKUN

茶道、 華道

This is fairly polite example to point to when a Japanese asks you, "Do foreigners really think we're a cold people?" BOOBOO: most Japanese don't say きっさてん。 they just say 喫茶、(きっさ)。

to agree in theory　(business - speak). Stronger than 承る（うけたまわる）.

承知 is what you say when you have heard and understood a business proposal, and you agree with it. It doesn't necessarily mean that you will sign the contract or do whatever the person says; merely that you want to work together with them to accomplish these goals, in theory, after 100 more meetings.

Although most Japanese will say パラノイア in casual conversation.

components: 我 (we) + 慢 (neglect/ egotistic) = 我慢 (persevere)
labels: CCW 1/2 KANA
description:
to endure, to bear something. Often translated as 'patience,' but that is not quite right. You have patience if you can do data entry on a fucking kanji dictionary for 5 hours straight, but you gaman with your overtime or while taking final exams with a burst appendix.

Masochists tend to gaman when they're fed worms while tied up.

Sometimes the concept of gaman DOES overlap with the English idea of patience, though: Little kids have to gaman if they find out that Disneyland is still 4 hours away.

One possible way to make GAMAN fit with the theme of 'neglect' is to remember that the 'ga' part means 'self.' So GAMAN means 'neglect yourself,' or, more poetically, 'Stop feeling the pain of your body and mind, and concentrate on the task at hand.'
