components: 福 (good luck) + 袋 (sack) = 福袋 (the mystery bag)
labels: KUN ON
description: a mystery bag, a grab-bag that stores use to get rid of old inventory.

components: 裁 (trial) + 判 (judgement) = 裁判 (trial)
description: trial or lawsuit - a court case, anyway!

components: 褒 (praise) + 美 (beauty) = 褒美 (reward)
labels: KIDS
description: prize - but not like on Wheel of Fortune or the lottery. Like if your kid cleans her room, you give her a cupcake. Or if your dog performs a trick, you give it a bone.

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning, 'hidden side' or 'dark side' of XXX.

meaning: illegal porno books with no mosaic.
components: 裏 (backside) + 本 (book / the real) = 裏本 (illegal porno books with no mosaic.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 衰 (decline,wane) + 退 (retreat) = 衰退 (decline)
description: decline of the economy, decline and fall of the Roman empire, decline of Western Civilization Part 2.

meaning: to be released from the hospital
components: 退 (retreat) + 院 (institution) = 退院 (to be released from the hospital)
退 (retreat) + 屈 (yield, get out of the way) = 退屈 (boring)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: boring!（verb form : 退屈した： "It was boring!"）

components: 浪 (wavelike) + 費 (expenses) = 浪費 (waste)
labels: NP
description: a waste of time or energy; a financial loss

components: 浪 (wavelike) + 人 (person) = 浪人 (masterless samurai)
description: masterless samurai or misfit nerd obsessed with same - note the left kanji means 'wavelike', and a ronin is a kind of drifter.

components: 痛 (hurts!!!) + 恨 (hold a grudge) = 痛恨 (deep , bitter regret)
根 (root) + 本 (book / the real) = 根本 (the fundamentals)
description: the fundamentals (how is it different from 基本？ Well, with 根本, the emphasis is: the fundamental, deep, organizing principles, not the most easy 'for dummies' bits). The essential and underlying - as opposed to on the surface and easily apparent) Also handy:こんぽんてきな (the adjective form)

components: 根 (root) + 気 (mood) = 根気 (patience)
description:
patience. You need 根気 to be able to 我慢 (がまん）。

Often used like 根気がいい（she's very patient!) or, 根気よくｘｘｘした！　(you did xxx very patiently!)

components: 根 (root) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 根性 (balls)
description: guts　/balls (for instance, giving yourself cigarette burns to prove some kind of point about being a man)

components: 限 (limit) + 界 (the world) = 限界 (a limit)

description: it's not necessarily the case that xxx!

components: 帰 (go back home) + 郷 (one's hometown) = 帰郷 (return to one's hometown)
故 (breakdown, accident) + 郷 (one's hometown) = 故郷 (hometown )
labels: F
description: A somewhat literary word for one's hometown （BOOBOO: most people just say 実家　（じっか）, meaning "parents' house" instead).

components: 影 (shadow) + 響 (echo) = 影響 (influence)
description: influence (You don't say "x influences Y," you have to say "Y recieves X's influence." (YYYはXXXの影響を受けた）

components: 階 (story of a building) + 段 (step / stairs) = 階段 (stairway)

labels: COUNTER
description: story of a building. いっかい、にかい、さんかい。。。

components: 段 (step / stairs) + 階 (story of a building) = 段階 (step/phase)
description: a step in a process. A measure, as in "We're taking steps to reduce your mother's underarm emanations." Also a palindrome of stairway!

components: 障 (impede) + 害 (damage) = 障害 (disability)
description: 2 meanings. 1= a disability, like a handicapped person . 2= an obstacle like some shit in the road.

components: 保 (guarantee/maintain ) + 障 (impede) = 保障 (safeguards.)
description: safeguards or security, like at the airport. It also can refer to a deposit - a promise to pay money if you damage something.

components: 防 (ward off) + 犯 (commit a crime) = 防犯 (anti-crime)
description: anti-crime / crime-prevention (you tend to see this word on hidden cameras or locks a lot)

labels: PRE
description: PREFIX meaning, xxx proof, or xxx resistant. (for instance, 防水のnippleclamps(ぼうすいの) water-proof nippleclamps. Handy!

components: 予 (beforehand) + 防 (ward off) = 予防 (precaution)
一 (one) + 部 (section) = 一部 (some of)
description: some / a certain part of (some complaints / part of the community / some lesbian separatists / some parts of the body / part of the crops)(

components: 細 (slender) + 部 (section) = 細部 (a detail)
解 (solve / untie) + 剖 (dissect) = 解剖 (dissect)
description: dissect - both literally and figuratively: to psychoanalyze someone, or understand their motivations.

components: 壮 (epic!!!) + 大 (big) = 壮大 (epic)
description: magnificent, epic

components: 服 (clothes) + 装 (dress up) = 服装 (dressed like that.)
description: a manner of dress- not just a uniform. If you tell your daughter she's not leaving the house 'dressed like that', that's 服装. Or if someone shows up to your party dressed way too formally, that's also a 服装 problem.

components: 変 (change) + 装 (dress up) = 変装 (disguise)
背 (stature / back of the body) + 中 (middle) = 背中 (small of the back)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 背 (stature / back of the body) + 負 (lose) = 背負う (carry on back)
description: せお＊う： lit： to carry on one's back. Figuratively, to assume the burden of.

components: 制 (system) + 服 (clothes) = 制服 (uniform)
description: uniform (nurse, student, policeman, fireman, stewardess, army guy. . .)

components: 制 (system) + 度 (times) = 制度 (system)
電気 (electricity) + 製 (mass production) + 品 (products) = 電気製品 (consumer electronics)
description: consumer electronics- anything from stereos to calculators to ipods. Radio Shack, Bic P Kan, and Yodobashi Camera are 電気製品 stores.

labels: SUF
description:
This is a SUFFIX which has two meanings, to wit:

1：made from XXX. For instance: 木製：もくせい： made from wood. (***)

2： made in such-and-such a country. 日本製： にほんせい： things (usually electronics or clothes) made in Japan. (**) 製造：せいぞう： manufacturing (**)

components: 製 (mass production) + 造 (produce) = 製造 (manufacturing)
labels: NP
description: manufacturing, production

components: 告 (inform) + 白 (white) = 告白 (confess)
description: to confess- both to a crime and to having a huge crush on me.

components: 報 (data) + 告 (inform) = 報告 (reporｔ)
labels: NP
description:
a report. 報告 has more of a nuance of a scientific, governmental, or corporate report than the related term 情報 (news report)

Think about it like this: 報告 are commissioned by private agencies, and then journalists do a 情報 about the 報告.

components: 創 (originate / creative) + 造 (produce) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 創造的 (creative)
description: creative (BOOBOO: don't confuse it with the OTHER そうぞう：想像, which means 'imagine.') (I know, it's pernicious!)

components: 酷 (horrendous) + 使 (use) = 酷使 (abuse)
洗 (wash) + 脳 (brain) = 洗脳 (brainwash)
labels: NEO

particle_after: である　or になる
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 優 (kindhearted/excel) + 先 (earlier/ the tip) = 優先 (priority)
description: priority (make it a priority: xxx優先されてる）

components: 俳 (actor) + 優 (kindhearted/excel) = 俳優 (actor)
男 (man) + 優 (kindhearted/excel) = 男優 (actor)
女 (woman) + 優 (kindhearted/excel) = 女優 (actress)
縮 (contract / shrink) + 小 (small size) = 縮小 (cut back)
labels: NP
description: to reduce, cut back on something. (business word)

components: 砂 (sand) + 糖 (sugar) = 砂糖 (sugar)
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 基 (basis) + 礎 (foundation) = 基礎 (foundation)
description: literally this kanji means 'foundation stone,' but unless you're a student of architectural history, you'll be using the metaphorical meaning instead: 基礎 means 'the fundamentals' (of a language,of a philosophy, or a martial art, etc.)

components: 渋 (bitter flavor) + 滞 (delay / be overdue) = 渋滞 (traffic jam)
延 (prolong) + 滞 (delay / be overdue) = 延滞 (late payment.)
主 (master/mainly) + 催 (sponsor) = 主催 (sponsor)
labels: NP
description: sponsor a medium party or company event (like 催す（もよおす） but the emphasis is on 'sponsor' (i.e. provide money in exchange for publicity), where as もよおす has more to do with actually doing the work - arranging the chairs and snacks and sweeping the floor, and so on).

components: 崩 (collapse) + 壊 (break) = 崩壊 (collapse)
description: a collapse- said of a building, but also (figuratively) like 'The collapse of communism.'

components: 密 (hard to see) + 輸 (transport) = 密輸 (smuggling)
幽 (occult) + 霊 (ghost) = 幽霊 (ghost)
description: a vengeful ghost - unlike 悪霊（あくりょう） and 妖怪 （ようかい）, 幽霊 were once human and driven by revenge. 幽霊 are more popular in horror movies (like The Ring), whereas 妖怪 are more traditional.

components: 石 (rock) + 炭 (carbon) = 石炭 (coal)
山 (mountain) + 岳 (mount) = 山岳 (really big mountains!)
納 (to supply) + 豆 (bean) = 納豆 (nattou)
labels: FP
description: sticky, disgusting soybean remnants that Japanese like to inquire if you can tolerate them.

components: 豆 (bean) + 腐 (rot) = 豆腐 (tofu!)
豆 (bean) + 乳 (milk) = 豆乳 (soymilk)
喜 (rejoice) + 劇 (play) = 喜劇 (comedy)
頑 (stubborn) + 張 (stretch) = 頑張る (good luck!)
labels: CCW 1/2 KANA
description: No exact English equivalent. がんばる combines two English expressions: 1) do your best! 2) good luck! You tell your friends 頑張れ！ before a big test or job interview.

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning, 'around the time of xxx' (often pronounced ごろ）.

components: 時 (time) + 頃 (around that time) = ８時頃 (around 8-ish)
labels: KUN ON
description: around 8 o'clock. (check the GORO action!)

components: 頂 (summit/climax) + 点 (point) = 頂点 (peak)
description: climax or peak (the zenith of his popularity / lonely at the top / peak of fascism's power/ the climax of the song, etc)

components: 月 (moon) + 額 (amount of money / forehead) = 月額 (monthly amount)
description: the monthly amount of money

components: 人 (person) + 類 (category,type) = 人類 (race of people)
種 (seed　/ type or kind) + 類 (category,type) = 種類 (variety or type of thing)

meaning: to classify or divide into groups
components: 分 (understand / divide / minute) + 類 (category,type) = 分類 (to classify or divide into groups)

description: a general tendency or demographic trend (not one specific person and not with any intention) (i.e. people who watch 8 hours of tv a day tend to drool) (BOOBOO: not used about fashion trends, which are conscious and intentional, and called 流行 (りゅうこう))

components: 項 (item/paragraph) + 目 (eye) = 項目 (clause)
description: an item (on the agenda), a clause, a subject heading

description: order of people in a line (take a number!) - order of bands on a live show.

components: 順 (sequence) + 調 (check out) = 順調 (no problem)

components: 順 (sequence) + 序 (first part / preface) = 順序 (sequence of steps)
description: the sequence of steps in a proceedure - the order of books arranged by a certain system, (i.e. Dewey Decimal).

components: 教 (teach) + 訓 (kunyomi) = 教訓 (lesson)

a lesson. Often used like this:

きょうくん　に　なった！('That taught me a lesson!')

labels: KUN ON

components: 磁 (magnet) + 石 (rock) = 磁石 (a magnet)
羊 (sheep) + 毛 (fur) = 羊毛 (wool)

description: foxy lady - could be a tramp or a classy broad.

components: 美 (beauty) + 少年 (young boy) = 美少年 (cute underage boy)

洋 (Pacific Ocean / the West) + 風 (wind / the flu / style) = 洋風 (western style)

components: 東 (east) + 洋 (Pacific Ocean / the West) = 東洋 (east-and-west)

components: 下 (below) + 着 (wear / arrive) = 下着 (underwear)

description: arrive- usually you only hear this over the loudspeakers at train stations, airports, etc.

components: 栄 (glory) + 養 (cultivate, rear) = 栄養 (nutrition)
教 (teach) + 養 (cultivate, rear) = 教養 (refinement)
description: culture and refinement - think of My Fair Lady.

components: 養 (cultivate, rear) + 子 (child) = 養子 (adopted child)

description: an adopted child. See, and you thought I was just being a dick. Don't blame the messenger, people!

components: 義 (righteousness) + 務 (perform a task) = 義務 (social obligation)
description: an obligation to society - like voting, paying taxes, going to school, or in some cases, the army.

components: 義 (righteousness) + 理 (reason) = 義理 (obligation)

description: obligation or honor debt. Like, you went to my band's show now I have to go to your band's show even though you guys are really terrible.

components: 礼 (polite) + 儀 (politeness) = 礼儀 (Formal manners)

components: 辞 (quit) + 儀 (politeness) = 辞儀 (bow)

description: a serious, formal bow - the real bow, not the head-nod.

components: 議 (discussion) + 論 (make a case for) = 議論 (argument)
description: not quite an argument, but definitely a spirited loud discussion.

components: 様 (important person) + 子 (child) = 様子 (the situation)
labels: FP
description: the situation. Usually used in medicine or business: The patient's situation is grave. We'll wait and see if the market situation improves. 様子を見ましょう！ The other main way it's used is: 様子がおかしい！　Which means, 'Something funny is going on here!' or 'There's something funny about that person.' 'You mean the homeless with a stuffed duck on his head?' 'Yes.'
All different kinds of xxx. Very similar to 色々（いろいろ）, but 様々 means more like "all the kinds of" rather than "many kinds of."

components: 爆 (explode) + 笑 (laugh) = 爆笑 (explosive laughter)
description: to laugh explosively- to suddenly and convulsively guffaw

components: 見 (look) + 送 (send) = 見送る (see off)

components: 送 (send) + 仮 (provisional) + 名 (name, famous) = 送り仮名 (okurigana)
description: these are the hiragana letters dangling from the end of kanji, like the "べる" in 食べる or the "り" in 送り仮名。 okurigana are useful because they cue you to pronounce the kanji using KUN yomi, rather than ON.

components: 春 (spring /sexy) + 巻 (roll up) = 春巻き (spring rolls)

COUNTER
description: 一巻、二巻、三巻; いっかん、にかん、さんかん、 : first , second, third volumes in a series of books

components: 竜 (dragon) + 巻 (roll up) = 竜巻 (whirlwind)
description: whirlwind or tornado

components: 圏 (range / area of influence) + 外 (outside) = 圏外 (out of range)

description: the English -speakng world; countries that speak English (no stars. . .This isn't used very often, but it gives you a good idea of what this kanji means)

labels: SUF
description:
Take pretty much any noun you can think of, and aｄd "券" to the end, and you have invented a coupon for that noun.

to wit；

食券： eat ＋ ken ＝ meal ticket . . .

商品券： merchandise ＋ ken ＝ discount coupon . . .

定期券：commute ＋ken ＝ commuter pass

etc. . .
literally, to boil some water. Figuratively; to seethe with anger or get too excited

components: 消 (erase) + 費 (expenses) = 消費 (consume)

components: 遺 (bequeath) + 跡 (vestiges) = 遺跡 (ruins)

components: 恋 (passion) + 人 (person) = 恋人 (lover)

description: lover - (BOOBOO: 恋人 is usually the good kind, where no one's cheating. The bad one is 愛人）

components: 失 (miss out on) + 恋 (passion) = 失恋 (get your heart broke)

危 (dangerous) + 険 (steep / risky) = 危険 (risky, unsafe)

components: 検 (investigate) + 討 (attack/discuss) = 検討 (give consideration to)
labels: NP
description: to give thorough consideration to the topic. To investigate something thoroughly. Often said by politicians who don't want to give a real answer.

components: 倹 (thrifty) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 倹約 (frugal)
description: frugal, saving money, getting bargains. (BOOBOO - 倹約 is used in a good way. If you want to say someone is cheap, say 'kechi!')

components: 真 (really) + 剣 (saber) = 真剣 (serious or earnest)

description: the wooden-sword-fighting martial art

components: 経 (experience) + 験 (test) = 経験 (experience)

components: 微 (teeny) + 鏡 (mirror) = 顕微鏡 (microscope)

components: 銀 (silver) + 行 (go) = 銀行 (bank)

description: Ginza , a ritzy neighborhood in tokyo

components: 針 (needle) + 金 (gold) = 針金 (a wire)

components: 銅 (bronze) + メ () = 銅メダル (bronze medal.)

labels: FP NP
description: plan - not like, 'I'm planning on going to Lake Tahoe this weekend," but like a big-time business plan or world-domination scheme.

labels: PRE
description: as a prefix, it means the main (office, manager, road) rather than a branch one

components: 途 (on the way) + 中 (middle) = 途中 (on the way)
description: on the way to XXX (I stopped and got some chips and a sody).

components: 排 (eliminate) + 除 (exclude) = 排除 (to remove or eliminate )

description: means "warehouse," but also "storage" (as in the English phrase, "It's in storage.") 倉庫 is a stand-alone building - a warehouse or shack in back.

components: 創 (originate / creative) + 造 (produce) + 性 (sex / essential nature) = 創造性 (creativity)
独 (solitary) + 創 (originate / creative) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 独創的 (seminal)
description: seminal or original - a new idea that was the basis for a trend. None of the bands you like are dokusouteki. They're all ripping off the dokusouteki artists. You poser

components: 介 (introduce / intervene) + 入 (put/go in) = 介入 (intervention)

description:
Suffix meaning, 'the world of XXX', as in

政界(せいかい) (the world of politics) or. . . .

芸能界 (げいのうかい) (the world of show biz)

components: 給 (provide) + 料 (ingredients / fees) = 給料 (wages)

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX - for example, エッフェル塔= Eiffel tower.

components: 搭 (board) + 載 (appear in print) = 搭載 (come equipped with)
description: to come equipped with XXX (built-in camera, etc.)

components: 残 (remain behind) + 念 (concern) = 残念 (That's too bad!!)
description: "That's too bad." - kind of informal ; say this when someone didn't enjoy a movie they went to, or couldn't come to your party because they got the flu.
as a precaution, in case something goes wrong.

components: 命 (life) + 令 (command) = 命令 (a command)
description: an order, a command.

components: 呼 (call to someone) + 鈴 (tiny electric bell or buzzer) = 呼び鈴 (doorbell)
大 (big) + 統 (tradition) + 領 (territory) = 大統領 (President)

components: 理 (reason) + 不 (un) + 尽 (exhaust, use up) = 理不尽 (unreasonable)

components: 終 (end) + 電 (electricity) = 終電 (the last train )

components: 容 (appearance) + 姿 (someone's shape, body, form) = 容姿 (one's looks)
演 (performance) + 奏 (musical performance) = 演奏 (perform)
description: perform music or a play

labels: KANA COUNTER
description: 一冊（いっさつ）＝１ book, 二冊　（にさつ)＝two books, etc.

偏 (be inclined) + 見 (look) = 偏見 (prejudice　)
description: prejudice or bias　－not always racial

components: 論 (make a case for) + 文 (culture/ sentence) = 論文 (essay)
description: an essay, like a senior thesis.

components: 理 (reason) + 論 (make a case for) = 理論 (theory)
description: theory, as in science or "theory vs. practice"

components: 討 (attack/discuss) + 論 (make a case for) = 討論 (discussion)
labels: NP

components: 倫 (principles) + 理 (reason) = 倫理 (principles)
description: one's personal ethics or principles

components: 附 (attachment) + 属 (genus/affiliation) = 附属 (affiliated)
description: affiliated - i.e. a research institute which is affiliated or attached to a certain university. Or, included, as in 'use the gloves included with the hair-bleach kit.'

components: 集 (collect) + 団 (group) = 集団 (group)
description: a group of people united for a purpose (Citizens Environmental Lawsuit Group),

components: 団 (group) + 子 (child) = お団子 (dumpling kebab)
description: a little fried dumpling, usually served 3 to a shish kebab.

components: 切 (cut / important) + 符 (ticket) = 切符 (tickeｔ)

description: a tickeｔ (only used for a concert or a train, or bus)

components: 寿 (lifespan/sushi) + 司 (administer) = 寿司 (sushi)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: hamburgers?? Hot dogs??? Dumbass.

components: 慰 (console) + 謝 (apologize) + 料 (ingredients / fees) = 慰謝料 (compensation money, alimony.)

description: to introduce - not a person but a new concept or thing. "Billy Fuckpants introduced tea to Europe from China."

components: 戦 (fight) + 闘 (struggle) = 戦闘 (a battle)
詩 (poem) + 人 (person) = 詩人 (poet)
詩 (poem) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 詩的 (poetic)

labels: SUF
description:
SUFFIX . . . actually, it's one of TWO Japanese suffixes that both mean 'plural.' 等 is kind of a more macho suffix than 達(たち）, and it's ONLY used in the following words : 彼等： かれら(them)

. . . .and あいつ等：あいつら (those clowns) . . . and 奴等：やつら (those assholes over there)

labels: FP

components: 尊敬 (respect) + 語 (language) = 尊敬語 (formal Japanese)
labels: F
description: the formal Japanese you use when you are addressing your superiors.

components: 尊 (esteem) + 敬 (respect) = 尊敬 (respect)
description: to look up to or respect someone. (BOOBOO: it's not ok to tell someone directly, 'I 尊敬 you very much!' - you'd say it about a third party)

components: 郊 (suburb) + 外 (outside) = 郊外 (suburb)
効 (effective) + 率 (ratio) = 効率のいい (efficient)
逆 (opposite) + 効果 (an effect) = 逆効果 (the opposite effect )
description: the opposite effect from what you'd intended.

labels: SARC
description: someone is a specialist for XXX. In other words, they have a fetish for xxxx. Like デブ専 is a "fat person specialist"

components: 束 (bundle of sticks) + 縛 (tie up) = 束縛 (restrain)
description: to restrain, to restrict, tie up in red tape.

components: 薄 (weak or thin) + 情 (emotion) = 薄情 (cold-hearted )
講 (lecture) + 演 (performance) = 講演 (a non-political speech)
description: any public speech or talk given to a general audience. Authors doing a reading, dudes addressing a club, the graduation speaker at your graduation, are all doing 講演.

components: 演 (performance) + 歌 (sing) = 演歌 (enka)
labels: CCW
description: a genre of really un-hip music Japanese grandparents and hicks listen to - it's been called "the country western music of Japan", but it's much more. When you listen to Enka, or sing it in a karaoke bar, you can cry and express emotion.

components: 知 (know) + 恵 (do a favor) = 知恵 (wisdom)
labels: FP

particle_after: のある or をつける
components: 悪 (bad) + 知恵 (wisdom) = 悪知恵 (cunning, crafty)

description: security deposit (on your Haunted House (which you don't get back if you damage the ghosts in any way))

components: 満 (full) + 員 (clerk) = 満員 (all full up!)

components: 満 (full) + 月 (moon) = 満月 (full moon)

description: full moon. Also, when you moon someone with your ass, that is also a mangetsu.

components: 肥 (obese / manure) + 満 (full) = 肥満 (obesity)
豊 (plentiful) + 満 (full) = 豊満 (voluptuous)
labels: ABU
description: not what it sounds like! Houman means zatfig, voluptuous. This has two meanings： a) a borderline sexual-harassment word used generally about the big titty women. b) a a relatively polite way to describe a chubby woman. Anyway, ABU!

components: 窮 (to be in trouble) + 屈 (yield, get out of the way) = 窮屈 (tight-assed. )
description: ：stiff or formal, tight-assed.

components: 発 (launch) + 掘 (dig) = 発掘 (excavation )

labels: PRE
description: PREFIX。 it means 'canned.' 缶ビール is a can of beer.

components: 動 (movement) + 揺 (sway, joggle) = 動揺 (jolt)
description: to be agitated or unsettled, to be jolted

components: 葉 (leaf) + 書 (write) = 葉書 (postcard)

components: 出 (pull out / hand over) + 歯 (tooth) = 出っ歯 (buckteeth; rabbit-lookin'-ass teeth.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 年 (year) + 齢 (stage of life) = 年齢 (years old)
高 (tall) + 齢 (stage of life) + 者 (professional) = 高齢者 (old person )
凶 (terrible) + 悪 (bad) = 凶悪 ( Heinous!)
description: atrocious! Heinous! Some Rape of Nanking kind of shit.

components: 大 (big) + 凶 (terrible) = 大凶 (horrible luck)
description: horrible luck, an atrocity.

labels: FR
description: gray matter, brains.- the "miso" part is written in hiragana, but it comes from the word 味噌, or 'soup'!!!

components: 離 (divorce / physical distance between things) + 婚 (marriage) = 離婚 (divorce)
分 (understand / divide / minute) + 離 (divorce / physical distance between things) = 分離 (segregation / separation)
description: The dictionary says "separation, " as in separation of church and state, or "the river separates the two countries." Politically it means to segregate people, like in the American South, or what Japan does to Burakumin.

components: 容 (appearance) + 疑 (doubt) + 者 (professional) = 容疑者 (suspect)
description: suspect in crime; foreigner.

components: 擬 (sham) + 似 (resemble) = 擬似 (quasi)

description: PREFIX meaning 'quasi-XXX'

description: two meanings: 1) ethnic group, 2) folk (as in folk customs, folk music, etc)

components: 候 (climate/candidate) + 補 (supplement) = 候補 (candidate)
気 (mood) + 候 (climate/candidate) = 気候 (regional climate)
description: climate - not like the weather we're having today, but the general climate of a region - temperate, tropical, etc.

components: 兆 (omen) + 候 (climate/candidate) = 兆候 (a sign)
description: a sign that something will start soon: (Those clouds on the horizon are a sign a taiphoon is coming)

components: 失 (miss out on) + 礼 (polite) = 失礼 (rude)
description: rude, without manners.

components: 観 (point of view) + 念 (concern) = 観念 (notion)
description: a notion, an idea. (BOOBOO: Not like 'I got an idea! Let's start a food CO-OP!' But idea like, 'He has no concept of personal hygine.' 'That's a very stereotypical idea!')

components: 勧 (recommend) + 告 (inform) = 勧告 (to counsel)

description: to advise or counsel someone.

components: 人 (person) + 権 (rights) = 人権 (human rights )

components: 権 (rights) + 力 (strong) = 権力 (power)
description: power (over other people)(as in boss, parent, governor, pope, etc.)

components: 確 (make certain) + 率 (ratio) = 確率 (probability)

labels: NP
description: certainty. This is never used as a verb. You'd never say 確実する。

components: 重 (heavy / overlap) + 点 (point) = 重点 (the important point. )
垂 (drip, dangle) + 直 (correct a probem / direct contact) = 垂直 (vertical, but also means perpendicular.)

description: This word used only during war (excuse me, during KINETIC OPERATIONS), and it means territory or positions held by a military force.

components: 指 (finger / point at) + 輪 (ring/tire) = 指輪 (ring)
labels: KUNKUN
description: THIS is the ring you wear!

components: 車 (car) + 輪 (ring/tire) = 車輪 (tire)
輪 (ring/tire) + ム () = 輪ゴム (rubber band)
labels: KUNKUN
COUNTER
description: basically the only time you will see this is as a counter for houses or shops: いっけん、にけん、さんけん、 etc.: For example:彼はレストランを三軒もつ。 ("He owns 3 restaurants")

components: 柔 (flexible) + 軟 (soft) = 柔軟 (flexible)
description: flexible, like a Crazy Straw / elastic
Basically means the same thing as 載せる、 but 掲載 is a little more formal: to be reported.

components: 軍 (army) + 隊 (troop) = 軍隊 (army)
description: an army - but not necessarily the whole army. It could just be some troops.

components: 軍 (army) + 人 (person) = 軍人 (soldier)
陸 (continent) + 軍 (army) = 陸軍 (The Land Army )
description: The Land Army (as opposed to navy or airforce)

meaning: reveal the extent of one's power

components: 指 (finger / point at) + 揮 (brandish) + 者 (professional) = 指揮者 (conductor or commander)
運 (carry / luck) + 転 (roll over) = 運転 (drive a vehicle)

reading: うんがいい　/　うんがわるい
components: 運 (carry / luck) + 悪 (bad) = 運がいい　/ 運が悪い (lucky / unlucky)

description: luxurious, in a good way

components: 中 (middle) + 華 (flamboyant) = 中華 (Chinese)
description: Chinese (often seen on the signs of Chinese restaurants)

components: 睡 (sleep) + 眠 (sleepy) = 睡眠 (sleep )

description: a somewhat medical-sounding word for sleep (BOOBOO: you would never say, "よく睡眠した?" -You gotta say, "よくねた?")

components: 睡眠 (sleep ) + 薬 (medicine) = 睡眠薬 (sleeping pill)
郵 (mail) + 便 (convenient　/ poop) + 番号 (number) = 郵便番号 (post number (i.e. zip code))

labels: PRE
description: PREFIX (sometimes SUFFIX!) meaning excessive - sometimes as in an overdose of drugs, an excess of personnel, but usually an excess of an attitude or behavior. This prefix is the only time you'll ever see the 剰　kanji.

components: 自信 (self-confidence) + 過剰 (excessive XXX) = 自信過剰 (overconfidence.)

労働 (manual labor) + 者 (professional) = 労働者 (laborer)

components: 非 (injustice / mistake) + 常 (usual) = 非常 (emergency)
description: emergency. This is the word on all the emergency exits and emergency firehoses. But you'd never say "I'm having an 非常！”

labels: PRE
description:
PREFIX meaning 'without xxx' Usually words use the 不 or 無　 prefixes, but occasionally you'll see a 非-word, like 非常識　（ひじょうしき）　(no common sense) 非対称的　（ひたいしょうてき）(asymmetrical).

I guess if 不 is like 'un-' and 無 is like 'without-', then '非-' is like 'no-'!!

meaning: Person ahead of you at school
components: 先 (earlier/ the tip) + 輩 (older or younger colleague) = 先輩 (Person ahead of you at school)
labels: CCW
description: Usually translated as "person ahead of you in school．"　(opp.後輩 (こうはい））. But the 先輩・後輩 system of unchanging, rigid heirarchy is in full effect all throughout Japanese society, from the punk scene to corporations and everywhere in between. People still call each other 先輩 40 years after they graduate.

components: 年 (year) + 輩 (older or younger colleague) = 年輩 (old person.)

labels: F

components: 悲 (sad) + 劇 (play) = 悲劇 (tragedy)
description: tragedy (opp: comedy!)

components: 悲 (sad) + 惨 (wretched) = 悲惨 ( terrible)
description: terrible, harrowing, tragic. Usually used not about a single person’s misfortune but like the tragic cost of war, the terrible catastrophe that befell the small town in Godzilla’s path, etc.

components: 犯 (commit a crime) + 罪 (sin) = 犯罪 (crime)
謝 (apologize) + 罪 (sin) = 謝罪 (apologize)
labels: NP

components: 俳 (actor) + 句 (verse of a poem) = 俳句 (haiku)
description:
yo mama so fat /

she went to the zoo one time /

kids fed her peanuts

labels: NP
description: to eliminate (another doctor word, which could mean poo OR pee, which is what is so excellent about it) (especially if you speak almost no Japanese but know really advanced medical terms for turd dropping)

components: 口 (mouth) + 軽 (lightweight) = 口が軽い (loose-tongued)
description: a loose tongue : either a mean gossip, or someone who can't keep a damn secret even if they try.

components: 経験 (experience) + 者 (professional) = 経験者 (survivor)
description: someone with experience - usually a negative experience. In which case the closest English word would be 'survivor' (of abuse, discrimination ,etc.)

components: 神 (GOD kanji) + 経 (experience) = 神経 (nerve cell)

description: a traditional Japanese monster from folk tales. They have physical forms, but don't necessairly attack people. More like the European "fairy" than "monster.

components: 見 (look) + 抜 (extract) = 見抜く (to see through)
description: to see through someone's pretension or their deception.

description: idiot( usually KANA, so one star : *)

components: 布 (fabric) + 団 (group) = 布団 (futon)

components: 希 (request / uncommon) + 少 (a little (amount)) = 希少 (rare animals or plants)

description: useless, academic word for rare animals or plants.

components: 恐 (dread) + 怖 (scary) = 恐怖 (super duper terror)
恐怖 (super duper terror) + 症 (symptom) = 恐怖症 (xxx- phobia)
labels: SUF

components: 若 (young) + 干 (dry out) = 若干 (somewhat)

components: 所 (area / attribute) + 有 (exist) + 者 (professional) = 所有者 (owner)
description: the owner of something. (しょゆうする； to own)

components: 有 (exist) + 益 (profit) = 有益 (beneficial)
labels: NP
description: useful or beneficial, (a policy beneficial to the State /it was a useful experience (a learning experience))

components: 差 (discriminate) + 別 (separate) = 差別 (discrimination)

labels: SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning, the mathematical difference between ２ things, as in 時差　（じさ： the time difference between two places).

components: 保 (guarantee/maintain ) + 存 (be aware of) = 保存 (preserve)
description: preserve - usually used with traditional culture or morals more than environmental causes. You'll often see this: 保存員会　（ほぞんいんかい） preservation committee.

components: 既 (already) + 存 (be aware of) = 既存 (the existing XXX)

片 (fragment) + 仮名 (kana) = 片仮名 (katakana)
description: katakana - the letterforms which are used to write foreign words and indicate emphasis. Oddly, the word "katakana" is written in Kanji. Kind of defeats the purpose?

出版 (publish) + 社 (company) = 出版社 (publishing company)

labels: NP
description: support - usually used with support groups like "adult children of alcoholics" or "a heartwarming show of support for a city which has had a natural disaster". It's not limited to victims but it has that sort of nuance to it.

components: 応 (react) + 援 (assist) = 応援 (cheeer on)
labels: KANA
description: to cheer for or root for someone at a game.

components: 金 (gold) + 髪 (hair) = 金髪 (blonde)
髪 (hair) + 毛 (fur) = 髪の毛 (head hair)
description: one single hair from a human head (as opposed to pubes), (i.e. there's a hair on the floor/ cloggin' the damn drain?)

components: 髪 (hair) + 型 (type / proper way) = 髪型 (hairstyle)

components: 白 (white) + 髪 (hair) = 白髪 (gray hair)
labels: FP

meaning: go to a temple to pray
components: 参 (admit defeat / visit) + 拝 (worship) = 参拝 (go to a temple to pray)
labels: NP

components: 修 (master a skill) + 理 (reason) = 修理 (fix)
description: to fix a thing- （BOOBOO: you don't 直す a car, or a computer, you 修理 it)

components: 研 (polish, sharpen) + 修 (master a skill) = 研修 (study, training )
惨 (wretched) + 事 (action/ incident) = 惨事 (tragedy)
description: a tragedy (BOOBOO: not as in a sad play, but as in someone's sister died while giving birth. A dramatic tragedy is 悲劇　（ひげき） )

components: 診 (diagnose) + 察 (police) = 診察 (medical exam)
廊 (corridor) + 下 (below) = 廊下 (corridor )
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 歯 (tooth) + 磨 (to brush) = 歯磨き (brush your teeth!)

description: the act of brushing the teeth ('Brush your teeth' = 歯を磨きます!）

components: 腐 (rot) + 女子 (female xxx / xxx for girls) = 腐 女子 (lady comic book nerd perv.)
labels: SARC
description: slang term for a lady into BL comics.

meaning: for now, for the time being,
components: 一 (one) + 応 (react) = 一応 (for now, for the time being,)
都 (major city) + 庁 (metropolitan government) = 都庁 (metropolitan government)

description: regular uniformed city cops (as opposed to local cops or specialized cops like 刑事　(けいじ, meaning detectives), FBI, etc.)

meaning: the kind of traditional Japanese sitting that makes your ankles fall off
components: 正 (correct) + 座 (sit) = 正座 (the kind of traditional Japanese sitting that makes your ankles fall off)

components: 麻 (mah jongg / ganja) + 酔 (drunk) = 麻酔 (anesthesia)
大 (big) + 麻 (mah jongg / ganja) = 大麻 (hemp)
摩 (friction) + 擦 (chafe) = 摩擦 (friction)

components: 拡 (to expand) + 大 (big) = 拡大 (zoom in / escalate)
description: Literally it means to zoom in on or magnify. Figuratively it means to escalate (a conflict) or scale-up (a buildup of some sort)

components: 庶 (populist) + 民 (folk) = 庶民 (the common people, Joe Lunchpail)
庶民 (the common people, Joe Lunchpail) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 庶民的 (populist, unpretentious, folksy)
出 (pull out / hand over) + 席 (seat) = 出席 (attendance )
labels: F
description: a kind of formal word for attendance (at an event)

components: 邪 (heresy) + 魔 (devil) = 邪魔 (interrupt)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: to interrupt. Often heard in the phrase: おじゃまします!('May I come in?') Used with co-workers or friends who are busy. Not used when you go to a store or someone's house.

components: 悪 (bad) + 魔 (devil) = 悪魔 (devil)
description: I am The Devil, do you understand?!? (used only for the Christian devil, not native Japanese demons,which are 鬼。)

components: 魔 (devil) + 法 (law) = 魔法 (witchcraft )
description: witchcraft - Applies to anything - flying, shooting lightning, turning dudes into trout.

components: 魔 (devil) + 女 (woman) = 魔女 (witch)

components: 魅 (enchant) + 惑 (be misguided or tempted) = 魅惑 (lure or fascination)

components: 醜 (ugly) + 悪 (bad) = 醜悪 (hideous, scandalous)

description:
hideous - more literary and more extreme than the related word 醜い (みにくい).

Also - unlike みにくい, 醜悪 is more often used figuratively to mean 'scandalous' : an ugly divorce, a scandalous rift between political factions.

components: 塊 (clump) + 魂 (soul) = 塊魂 (katamari damacy!)
卑 (despicable) + 怯 (get afeared) = 卑怯 (treacherous coward)
description: not just a coward ,but someone who does treacherous, trifling bullshit because they're a coward - like if they fight you they know they can't win fairly so they'll knee your groin, they're a 卑怯なmotherfucker.

components: 卑 (despicable) + 下 (below) = 卑下 (put yourself down)
description: to put yourself down (BOOBOO: only used when talking to others - mumbling "I suck!" to yourself doesn't count for some reason)

components: 彼 (him) + 氏 (mr. ) = 彼氏 (boyfriend.)
labels: KUNKUN
SUF
description: SUFFIX meaning 'Mr. XXX

meaning: first AND last name. But you wouldn't ever SAY 'What's your shimei?'
labels: NP
description:
In conversation, you'd just use 名前（なまえ） instead. ★☆☆☆☆ NP
氏 (mr. ) + 名 (name, famous) = 氏名 (first AND last name. But you wouldn't ever SAY 'What's your shimei?'

In conversation, you'd just use 名前（なまえ） instead. )

components: 徹 (do thoroughly) + 底 (bottom) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 徹底的 (to do XXX thoroughly)
description: to do XXX thoroughly, exhaustively, comprehensively. Plus, isn't that the greatest pronunciation? tetetetetetetetete!!! That's the most wild sound since the past tense of 'warm': (atatakatta)

components: 背 (stature / back of the body) + 低 (low) = 背が低い (dude is kind of short.)

labels: 1/2 KANA

the polite form of 'suru,' used by clerks when addressing your noble presence.　However, unlike 'suru', 'itashimasu' can be used with any verb.

XXX's verb form is 'masu minus': for instance, mochimasu becomes mochi itashimasu.

when a salariman gets transferred to another office, that's tenkin.

I only mention this because most of the Japanese you meet who speak good English, probably one of their parents got tenkin-ed to America / UK, so it tends to come up in conversation.

KANA

hunger (no stars!)

components: 処 (dispose of　or manage) + 理 (reason) = 処理 (take care of a problem.)

Often translated as 'management', 処理 is more like,"to take care of a problem. To resolve a complaint."

Unlike the related terms 経営(けいえい）　or 営む　（いとなむ）, 処理 is not a full-time job; more like something you do when an emergency happens.

contradiction / hypocrisy　 (interesting: the kanji literally mean 'spear plus shield'! Picture a guy claiming his shield is for self-defense, even as he holds a bloody spear in his other hand) . . ..

Japanese, tellingly, does not have a word for hypocrisy, so if you want to say hypocrite, you have to use this word (mujun) and try and make it fit.

severe, violent, terrible, fierce -

Unlike the related word 強烈（きょうれつ）、　もうれつ is usually used about natural phenomena: a fierce storm; a violent wild-fire. The toboggan moving at a scary intense velocity downhill. Also can be used with emotions: A violent argument after someone got caught cheating.

inspiration.

To get inspired: 霊感を受ける（うける）

To inspire someone: 霊感を与える（あたえる）

components: 加 (add) + 湿 (become damp, moisten) + 器 (instrument) = 加湿器 (humidifier)

components: 必 (surely) + 需 (demand) + 品 (products) = 必需品 (necessities)
description: necessities: both on everyday occasions and on adventures. Like if you're leaving the house you need your keitai and your keys! But also if you're going to the moon you need your ray gun and your moon bikini.

components: 中 (middle) + 途 (on the way) + 半 (half) + 端 (the edge) = 中途半端 (half-assed job)
description: this is an excellent phrase. It means, to do things halfway. Whether it's doing a half-ass job at your work, or taking a girl out on a date . . . .to burger king, or cleaning your room but only to the extent that your mom's turds are in a bag and not on the floor. - that's all CHUUTOHANPA.
No sooner had I done XXX, when YYY happened. (where the た is the end of a past-tense verb: tabeta, nonda, hashitta, etc.)

components: 文 (culture/ sentence) + 句 (verse of a poem) = 文句 (complain)

components: 禁 (prohibition) + 句 (verse of a poem) = 禁句 (forbidden, tabboo word)
警 (the fuzz) + 告 (inform) = 警告 (admonition)
description:
a warning or admonition. Not like "Be careful!" but more like "You better not!"

Usually applies to signs like "no tresspassing!"

components: 拘 (put in custody) + 留 (absent / stopped) = 拘留 (put in custody )

components: 下 (below) + 旬 (in season/ time of month) = 下旬 (end of month)

陶 (pottery) + 器 (instrument) = 陶器 (pottery)
婚 (marriage) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 婚約 (marriage engagement)
条 (clause) + 約 (promise/ roughly speaking) = 条約 (a treaty or pact)

labels: SUF
description: Mostly this is used as a SUFFIX which turns a noun into an adjective. Like how politics becomes 'political,' or how education becomes 'educational.' or economics becomes 'economical.' In Japanese, 政治　becomes　政治的な.

components: 理 (reason) + 想 (idea/imagination) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 理想的 (ideal.)
基 (basis) + 本 (book / the real) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 基本的 (the basics)
description:
the basics (the emphasis is: the minimum knowledge)

Also means fundamentally (emphasizing the essential bits that various things or ideas have in common)

components: 合 (to suit) + 理 (reason) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 合理的 (rational OR reasonable )
description: rational OR reasonable (i.e. get up at a reasonable hour or a reasonable compromise - like 'logical,' but used even if there is not a mathematical proof involved. Also has the nuance of efficient - the boss says to the worker 仕事合理的に進めなさい！　（しごと　ごうりてき　に　すすめ　なさい！）, meaning, 'Stop wasting our time and money! Work in a more efficient, rational way.'

components: 平 (equal / level) + 均 (average) = 平均 (an average)
description: an average (adjective form: 平均的な）

components: 均 (average) + 等 (equal /etc./plural) = 均等 (uniform, even)
description: uniform, even (both figurative and literal: level playing field, uniform lighting, equal opportunity)

components: 強 (burly) + 盗 (steal by stealth) = 強盗 (jack fools)

description: to steal in a violent, mugging kind of way.

components: 盗 (steal by stealth) + 作 (make) = 盗作 (plagiarism )
description: plagiarism - biting of one's style by a sucker MC.

components: 同 (same) + 盟 (oath) = 同盟 (alliance)

description: an alliance, league, union (usually used with military alliances: NATO, UN Security Treaty nations, the Warsaw Pact alliance, etc.)

components: 連 (take with / inform of) + 盟 (oath) = 連盟 (a federation)
labels: NP
description: a federation : unlike the related terms 連合 (れんごう）　and 同盟　（どうめい）, 連盟 is made of individual people, not federated nations or gangs. れんめい is more like volunteers. Baseball clubs, Chess associations, the League of Women Voters, are 連盟。

components: 盛 (heaps of!) + 上 (above) = 盛り上がる (to liven up)
description: to get exciting, to liven up.

components: 盛 (heaps of!) + マ () = 盛りマン (bulging pudenda)
labels: ABU CCW
description:
a bulging pudenda. Not like an average camel-toe. More like a set of labia that is thrusting out of a pair of tight pants like a she-boner.

Seriously, there's enough guys that are into this that they had to make up a word. Seems kind of a homo-erotic fetish to me.

But on the other hand, who says only guys should get to brag about the size of their units?

components: 監 (oversee) + 視 (peer at) = 監視 (to supervise)
description: to supervise, or watch over a project. Also means, to guard bad people - guards at a prison, a teacher who watches students at test time to keep them from cheating. (BOOBOO: don't mix this with 警備 (けいび), which is someone who is guarding or protecting good people or things).

components: 印 (stamp) + 鑑 (expert opinion) = 印鑑 (chop / seal)

description: a field guide; a book where each page has one picture and a description of a thing. (birds, gandams, monsters, doinks, whatever).

components: 鑑 (expert opinion) + 賞 (prize) = 鑑賞 (discriminating eye)
description: to have a 'discriminating eye' for art. To appreciate art or music on some deep, expert level.

components: 鑑 (expert opinion) + 定 (plan) = 鑑定 (expert opinion)

components: 大 (big) + 衆 (populace) = 大衆 (general public.)
description: general public - in the political sense. "This politician appeals to the general public." "Public sentiment is against the tax hike."

components: 名 (name, famous) + 誉 (honor) = 名誉 (honor/prestige)
description: An honor or prestige that comes in the form of a seal of approval or bonus points from an authority figure. Usually used like this : 名誉なこと。 名誉を受けた。

labels: PRE
description: PREFIX, meaning fiercely XXX (i.e.　猛反対：fiercely against)

components: 卑 (despicable) + 猥 (obscene) = 卑猥 (obscene)
description: Mostly used BY older men, and ABOUT a certain kind of person; Nasty, dirty, obscene. Not always used in a bad way.

labels: ABU
description: gross, obscene. Always bad. Used about a behavior , not the person doing it.

components: 猿 (monkey) + 真 (really) + 似 (resemble) = 猿真似 (Monkey see, monkey do!)

labels: SUF
description: hunting for XXX (including humans)

components: 独 (solitary) + 特 (special) = 独特 (unique)

description: autonomous - a colony becomes an independent country; a business start-up that is not under the umbrella of an established conglomerate, etc.

components: 地 (area) + 獄 (hell) = 地獄 (hell)

someone who is too formal, pompous, high-falutin'. You're like "Hi, dude!" and they're like "Salutations, my good man! Verily the sun doth shine like the Emperor's benign gaze upon this blessed land!"

labels: COUNTER

components: 乱 (disorder) + 暴 (rampage) = 乱暴 (violent)
description: violent - "He's a violent guy" or "She's a violent /crazy driver" - violent weather, (can be noun OR adjective OR verb!)

components: 複数 (multiple) + 形 (form) = 複数形 (plural)
description:
Plural - in English ! . . .The Japanese language doesn't really have a word for 'plural,' but Japanese use 複数形 to describe English plurals. So you'll need this word to correct your Japanese friends' frequent grammar boners.
"Look at the deers!"
"Deer doesn't have 複数形、, Yoshio。 3 deer is still 'deer'."
"チクショウ！”

components: 回 (rotate / times) + 復 (return or re-do) = 回復 (to recover)

description: greed : can be used about people OR greedy institutions- you greedy Americans, greedy-ass Wall Street.

'to put it in slang terms,XXX' . 'commonly,'as in 'your mom, commonly known as 'Big Bertha,'...)

description: boogers: (literally "nose poop"!!)

labels: SUF

suicide-bomb. (like PLO, not like Kamikaze) Suicide-bomb terrorism is 自爆テロ　（じばくてろ）

also - if you unintentionally blurt out a secret, you just じばくした!

You're the ones who forced me to learn your language, and now I speak it better than you! You can't even be bothered to open a dictionary and learn your own language, so who are you to judge me?"

２ meanings.

2： cuisine, as in, "My favorite cuisine is Mexican. My favorite cuisine is Indonesian."

components: 注 (pour / be careful) + 射 (shoot) = 注射 (injection)
反 (anti) + 射 (shoot) = 反射 (reflection)
窮 (to be in trouble) + 地 (area) = 窮地 (FUCKED)
description: to be up a creek, in a predicament, painted into a corner, fucked.

components: 実 (truth) + 施 (put into practice / charity) = 実施 (in full effect)
description: to put something - a plan or rule - into effect

components: 贈 (give) + 物 (animal / thing) = 贈り物 (a present)
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 一 (one) + 層 (layer) = 一層 (all the more)
description: all the more. As in, 'He ignores me and it just makes me love him all the more.'

labels: SUF
description:
SUFFIX meaning, 'layer of xxx.' As in,

オゾン層 (おぞんそう = ozone layer)

components: 階 (story of a building) + 層 (layer) = 階層 (stratum of society)
description: stratum of society - broke, blue-collar, middle-class, rich, oligarch
follow after someone all stalker-style.

components: 追 (follow) + 放 (release) = 追放 (deport)
description: to deport your Moms because she got naked on top of Tokyo Tower yelling 'Fuck Yamagichi-gumi!' through a bullhorn.

components: 小 (small size) + 遣 (apply) = 小遣い (one's allowance)
labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 管 (tube) + 理 (reason) = 管理 (management)
description: administration or management- you often see this on warning signs: "Don't walk on the grass - sincerely, the management", or on Windows "コンプター管理” (computer management)

components: 営 (manage (a business)) + 業 (business) + 中 (middle) = 営業中 (open for business)
description: open for business (a sign you'll see on every store window)

components: 経 (experience) + 営 (manage (a business)) = 経営 (to run your own business.)
過 (surpass / too much) + 労 (labor) + 死 (death) = 過労死 (death from overwork)
虚 (empty) + 栄 (glory) = 虚栄 (vanity)
感 (feeling) + 覚 (bear in mind) = 感覚 (physical sense)
description: a feeling or sense (touch / taste / smell / hearing, etc.)

components: 自 (my own) + 民 (folk) + 党 (political party) = 自民党 (LDP)
description: the Liberal Democratic Party - the MacArthur and CIA-backed party which has remained almost constantly in control of Japan since the war, by using their secret stash of funds that Tojo stole from Asia. A lot of post-war LDP bigshots were war criminals. Take that, post-Nazi Germany!

components: 共 (with) + 産 (childbirth, production of things) + 党 (political party) = 共産党 (the Japanese Communist Party.)
description: the Communist Party. Of course, they're not real communists, any more than the LDP are liberals. I have no idea what the fuck these guys believe in.

components: 甘 (sweet) + 党 (political party) = 甘党 (a sweet-tooth)
labels: SARC
description: another fine example of Japanese-style sarcasm： あまとう (literally 'sweet party') means someone who loves eating candy. Actually, you can use the 党 for many jokes this way.

components: 尚 (all the more) + 更 (all over again) = 尚更 (all the more)
labels: KANA

components: 賞 (prize) + 金 (gold) = 賞金 (prize money)
賞 (prize) + 品 (products) = 賞品 (prize)
description: any prize which is NOT cold cash money
compensation money. Reparations. Also used in lawsuits.

components: 日 (sun, day) + 常 (usual) = 日常 (everyday life)
description: everyday life - you know, on the quotidian tip.

components: 常 (usual) + 識 (be conscious) = 常識 (common sense)
食 (eat) + 堂 (assembly hall) = 食堂 (dining hall, cafeteria)
善 (morally good) + 人 (person) = 善人 (a virtuous person)
一 (one) + 周 (circumference) = 一周 (one time around)
description: one time around (the lake, the trail , etc.)

components: 彫 (carve) + 刻 (engrave) = 彫刻 (sculpture)
description: sculpture- but only the kind that is carved all Michelangelo's David style. The Rodin-style sculptures that are cast in bronze are OBJETs (that's right, they use a French word.)

components: 飲 (drink) + 過 (surpass / too much) = 飲み過ぎ (drunk too much!)
labels: SUF
description: drink too much. But really you can put "SUGI" after pretty much anything.

components: 円 (yen/circle) + 滑 (slippery) = 円滑 (effortless/smooth)
description: smooth, as in trouble-free and effortless.

components: 逃 (escape) + 亡 (dying) + 者 (professional) = 逃亡者 (refugee)
description: refugee; someone who is on the run

components: 眺 (look at for a long time while lost in thought) + 望 (desire) = 眺望 (prospect / view)
description:
1) (literally) a view from a high place (unlike related terms 景色　or 風景, 眺望 emphasizes the viewers' location, rather than the thing being looked at) ,

2) (figuratively) outlook or prospect for the future. (i.e. job prospects or, the outlook for 2009's stock market)

components: 挑戦 (challenge) + 者 (professional) = 挑戦者 (a contender, challenger)
桃 (peach) + 色 (color) = 桃色 (peach color. Duh.)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 唐 (suddenly) + 突 (thrust) = 唐突 (sudden, unexpected)
description: sudden AND unrelated to whatever came before it. Similar to 急に　 and 突然, but it emphasizes a random change, emphasizes that there is no cause-and-effect relationship. In other words, 唐突　is not just a sudden guy jumping out from behind a bush or a sudden thunderstorm. 唐突 is more like someone apropos of nothing changing the topic of conversation or getting mad for no apparent reason.

components: 毛 (fur) + 唐 (suddenly) = 毛唐 (hairy barbarian!)
labels: ABU OBSOLETE

components: 健 (healthy) + 康 (health) = 健康 (health)
放 (release) + 棄 (discard) = 放棄 (resign)
description: renounce, resign, "I don't sell that shit no more, dude."

components: 妻 (wife) + 子 (child) = 妻子 (wife and kids.)
description:
one's wife and children. The word for 'husband and children?'

That does not exist in this language.

components: 論 (make a case for) + 争 (battle) = 論争 (argument)
description: an argument or controversy

components: 兼 (double-duty) + 業 (business) = 兼業 (moonlighting. )
description: a second-job. moonlighting.

components: 兼 (double-duty) + 用 (utilize) = 兼用 (use as A and B)
description: to use something both as A and B.

components: 嫌 (eww!!) + 味 (flavor) = 嫌味 (hurtful speech)
labels: KUNKUN
description: a very general term for any kind of hurtful speech - from sarcasm or snarky comments, mean-spirited arguments, to outright belligerence.

components: 謙 (modesty) + 虚 (empty) = 謙虚 (modest)
description: modest - this is a word you use about others. "She's got a very modest attitude."

To downplay your own skills in front of others. You don't ever say "I 謙遜-ed." or "He 謙遜-ed." or "She's really 謙遜-ish."

Normally it's only used like : "Please don't 謙遜. We both know you're rad," or "He declined the offer out of modesty."

components: 建 (build) + 物 (animal / thing) = 建物 (building)
labels: KUNKUN
description: any kind of building - western OR japanese.

components: 延 (prolong) + 期 (period of time) = 延期 (postpone)
生 (life / birth) + 延 (prolong) = 生き延びる (outlive)
description: to outlive others, to survive a fucked event

components: 誕生 (birth) + 日 (sun, day) = 誕生日 (birthday)
labels: FP
description:
birthday

If you want to say Happy Birthday, you'd just say 良い誕生日！　（よいたんじょうび！）.

However, if you're asking someone what day is their birthday, you'd add 'の日’　like this:
誕生日の日はイツ？　（たんじょうびのひはいつ？）

components: 誕 (birthday / birth) + 生 (life / birth) = 誕生 (birth)
description: the birth of (figurative) (i.e. Miles Davis' "birth of the cool" album)

components: 小 (small size) + 銭 (coin) = 小銭 (coin)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 残 (remain behind) + 高 (tall) = 残高 (bank balance.)
labels: KUN ON
description: bank balance. You don't need to know this.

components: 盗 (steal by stealth) + 聴 (listen to) = 盗聴 (wiretap)
description: wiretap, bug

components: 壊 (break) + 物 (animal / thing) = 壊れ物 (fragile thing)
劇 (play) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 劇的 (dramatic)
劇 (play) + 団 (group) = 劇団 (drama troupe)
虐 (oppress) + 待 (wait) = 虐待 (violent oppression)
description: domestic violence, or some other bitterly bad but small-scale situation.

components: 皮 (skin) + 膚 (epidermis) = 皮膚 (skin)
labels: NP
description: a doctor word for skin. most people just say '肌' (はだ）

components: 就 (get a job, you bum!) + 職 (employment) = 就職 (find job)
description: to find a job (finally!)

components: 一 (one) + 蹴 (kick) = 一蹴 (dis and dismiss)
description: to dis someone so casually that it adds to the dis. To win a game too easily, to reject a complaint, to just look at someone like 'Who are you and why are you breathing my air?'

components: 核 (nucleus) + 兵器 (arms) = 核兵器 (nuclear weapons)
該 (correspond to) + 当 (hit the target) = 該当 (correspond to )
芝 (lawn) + 生 (life / birth) = 芝生 (lawn)
labels: FP

components: 芝 (lawn) + 居 (live) = 芝居 (theatrical play)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 学 (knowledge) + 期 (period of time) = 学期 (semester)
期 (period of time) + 間 (a period of time) = 期間 (period of time)
description: period of time, usually several months. Or years. Precise, socially constructed time, not seasons or shit. 期間 is more like summer vacation. You are forbidden to enter Japan for a period of five years.

components: 時 (time) + 期 (period of time) = 時期 (natural period of time)
description: period of time - refers to a natural or social phenomenon : rainy season, the time that you can see fall leaves, the humid time of year.

components: 甚 (enormous) + 大 (big) = 甚大 (fucking huge disaster)
description: ginormous, gigantic, fucking huge - almost always used about disasters. "The gigantic earthquake killed 1,000 dudes."

components: 勘 (perception) + 弁 (dialect) = 勘弁 (tolerate)
labels: 1/2 KANA
description: forgive, tolerate, stand by and let a motherfucker get away with.

labels: KANA
description: already, as mentioned before

components: 既 (already) + 婚 (marriage) = 既婚 (already married)
優 (kindhearted/excel) + 雅 (elegant) = 優雅 (refined)
description: elegant, graceful, refined

components: 一 (one) + 概 (general concept) = 一概 (generalize)
description: to make a sweeping generalization. (usually used in the negative: 一概には言えない (I don't want to generalize, but. . . ) )

components: 概 (general concept) + 念 (concern) = 概念 (concept)
鈍 (dull) + 感 (feeling) = 鈍感 (dimwitted)
description: dimwitted, insensitive, thick-headed, sarcasm-proof

meaning: opposite of xxx, or reacting against xxx
labels: PRE
description: this is a prefix, meaning "opposite of"- you can put it in front of any word, the way you'd use "Bizarrrro"

labels: 1/2 KANA
description: upside-down or inside-out xxx

components: 以 (compared to) + 前 (before) = 以前 (in the past)
description: previously, earlier, in the past

components: 物 (animal / thing) + 真 (really) + 似 (resemble) = 物真似 (to impersonate)
labels: KANA FP

components: 襲 (onslaught) + 撃 (charge) = 襲撃 (assault)
labels: NP
description: a raid. Like an assault done by a team of people, not just one mean guy. Usually used about the SWAT team raiding a house. But a gang can raid another gang.

components: 巡 (patrol) + 回 (rotate / times) = 巡回 (patrol)
巡 (patrol) + 礼 (polite) = 巡礼 (pilgrimage)
labels: F
description: pilgrimage (in Japan, this means traveling a mountain road and visiting one temple after another, rather than going to one central holy shrine like Jerusalem or Mecca)

components: 災 (disaster) + 害 (damage) = 災害 (natural disaster)
description: natural disaster - earthquake, fire, flood, your mother's flattus, etc.

components: 火 (fire) + 災 (disaster) = 火災 (disaster fire)
labels: NP
description: a slightly more newspaper-ish word for a harmful blaze.

components: 災 (disaster) + 難 (difficult) = 災難 (disaster)
description:
this means disaster - not in the sense of earthquakes or tsunami. Disaster in the sense of 'How was your trip to Tahiti?' 'Oh my god, it was a total disaster!!! First we missed the plane, then I got an infection, then on top of all that our hotel was run by zombies!'

災難　carries the sense of a bunch of random unconnected misfortunes. It never rains, but it pours, kind of thing.

components: 誤 (mistake) + 解 (solve / untie) = 誤解 (misunderstanding)
description: a misunderstanding- often used about situations (a la TV sitcoms) or when you misread someone's feelings.

components: 誤 (mistake) + 字 (letter) = 誤字 (tpo)
description: a typo

components: 孤 (isolation) + 独 (solitary) = 孤独 (solitude)
description: loneliness, solitude

components: 孤 (isolation) + 立 (stand up) = 孤立 (isolation)
孤 (isolation) + 児 (baby) = 孤児 (orphan)

description: parenthesis, or anything shaped like a parenthesis

components: 所 (area / attribute) + 為 (deed) = 所為で (xxx's fault)
labels: KANA FP
description: it's xxx's fault that . . .

components: 偽 (fake) + 物 (animal / thing) = 偽物 (counterfeit)
labels: KUNKUN

components: 偽 (fake) + 装 (dress up) = 偽装 (camouflage)
labels: NP
description: camouflage (including, of course, animals!)

components: 偽 (fake) + 造 (produce) = 偽造 (a forgery)
金 (gold) + 融 (fusion) = 金融 (financing, financial.)
融 (fusion) + 通 (pass) + 利 (handy) = 融通が利く (accomodating)
labels: FP
description: someone who is accommodating of your needs.

components: 融 (fusion) + 資 (capital (as in $$$)) = 融資 (getting financing)
labels: NP
description: getting financing or funding or a business loan (usually in return for taking the banker and his friends from the Ministry of Finance out for some hostess action and $3,000 sake). (and possibly 'accidentally' losing a golf game or two)

components: 隔 (segregate) + 離 (divorce / physical distance between things) = 隔離 (quarantine / put in internment camps)
description: to quarantine people - or 隔離背策：(かくりせさく)　an official policy to keep people in concentration camps, like USA did to Japanese-Americans during the war, or like Israel is doing in Palestine.

components: 隔 (segregate) + 週 (week) = 隔週 (every other xxx)
labels: PRE
description: PREFIX:every other (week, month, year, etc.)

components: 間 (a period of time) + 隔 (segregate) = 間隔 (small gap)
description: a small physical distance or gap - a literal space between two things: between two close-together buildings, say, or between the train and the platform.

components: 大 (big) + 丈夫 (sturdy, firm,healthy) = 大丈夫 (No problem.)
labels: CCW
description: literally, 'No problem.' But, don't believe a Japanese if they say this. A salariman can get drunk, stumble into the street, get his legs cut off by a bus, and still claim to be 'daijoubu.'

components: 丈 (robust) + 夫 (husband) = 丈夫 (sturdy, firm,healthy)

labels: F
description: polite way to begin a letter: "Dear Sir"

labels: 1/2 KANA

components: 相 (partner) + 互 (reciprocal) + 的 (motivation / '-al') = 相互的 (mutual, reciprocal.)
labels: NP

components: 交 (combine) + 互 (reciprocal) = 交互 (alternately)

meaning: (also sometimes pronounced み＊っつ) three things. Yes, it's got 2 pronunciations
woman - but don't say it by itself, it's like saying 'That broad.'
The noun form of 好む. You often say, 'That's my konomi,' meaning 'That's my favorite kind' . . . but it also implies that you know a lot about that thing.(***)

labels: 1/2 KANA
KANA NP

meaning: 'No'. Usually used by older people. Or pretentious authors, who contradict themselves for rhetorical effect: 'She was a proper woman, No, wait, perhaps I should rather say she was the kind of woman who wanted to be seen as proper, A-ha-ha, I am so clever.'
(also　pronounced just と）meaning, 'ten things'.  Yes, it has two pronunciations!
labels: JERK

meaning: one's dream comes true. Usually used like this: 夢が叶う-ゆめがかなう： my dream comes true!
suffix meaning, the total xxx. Total hours, total pounds, total hogs-heads, etc.
labels: SUFFIX

meaning: measure temprature, height, depth. If you're measuring a chair or your mom's stretch marks, use this one.
this is a really good word, meaning 'delicious!' or 'well done!'
labels: 1/2 KANA

meaning: ２ meanings： 1 -write to someone to the effect that xxx.
bunch of people chanting or reciting in unison - also, one person muttering something over and over in a creepy way.
early, as in, 'get up early.'　BOOBOO: this doesn't mean fast! that's the
to reschedule something (an appointment, a deadline) earlier
to be moved or rescheduled earlier in time　－to be done in a hasty or premature way.
spring, as in water popping out of the earth
to let your friends crash at your house.
SUFFIX which means juice, or soup (as in味噌汁：みそしる； (miso soup)) , . . .also semen

meaning: I blend the ingredients (BOOBOO: unlike the other まぜる　（交ぜる）, this word is used for technical stuff- science or cooking.
to be crowded (usually in the present perfect： こんでる!)
get mixed up in a situation: wrong place, wrong time.
bright , sunny weather / person with a sunny disposition.
an obvious, clear difference between two things
a big fire, but not a harmful one. Like a campfire or bonfire
faint color. (薄い also means faint, but 淡い carries the connotation of, it's faint because it's weak or sickly)

labels: SUF

meaning: Only used in peoples' names: 田中(たなか） is the Japanese version of Smith.
a small town -  but also a SUFFIX which means xxx-town. Like Levittown or Funkytown.
labels: SUF

meaning: SUFFIX meaning, "field of a particular crop". like いちご はたけ、(field of strawberries) or すいか はたけ (field of watermelons). You don't need an article like 'no' or 'na'.
labels: KUNKUN SUF

meaning: I put it in (I put the dog in the doghouse)
it goes in (The dog goes in the doghouse)
transform - this is ONLY used in the context of a person changing to a ghost, or a curse transforming a person into a werewolf. In other words, it is not used that often.
bitter taste ー medicine, okra. Can also be used figuratively - the bitter taste of defeat.
adjective describing mental suffering - which is caused BY 痛み　(physical pain). i.e. 'My throat is 痛い、 so talking or swallowing is 苦しい’
to hurt or suffer　from XXX
grass - tall, uncut grass.(BOOBOO: In practice, though, most people use　芝生 (しばふ）)
inside a thing, OR inside of a certain time frame(eat it while it's hot! 温かい内に食べて!) Also, it's a slang term for 'us.'

labels: LAZY

meaning: circircular　(not used! People use  the OTHER まるい　（丸い）  instead)
someone else's older sister- or, if you're a sexist douche, you can use it about any young woman, in the sense of 'hey sweetheart, bring me more tea, chop chop!' (hence the ABU tag)

meaning: to risk xxx (grave danger/ your life/ your anal virginity) doing crazy shit
to do something one's own self, in person

LAZY

meaning: an important person visits another important person (an official state visit, visit the pope, etc.)

meaning: to visit, like visit another country or visit a distant city or call on a friend in a far place.
dood, homeboy, (can also be rude if he's not actually your homeboy and he hears you) - also an informal term for 'thing,' kind of like the spanish "ese." ("Pass me that thing, ese!")

meaning: heart, metaphorically. 'All my heart' and that kind of good shit.

To think (BOOBOO: 思う　should not be confused with the other 'think' (考える　（かんがえる））. 思う is like, "I think your Moms is the source of the fungus." "I think the theater is over there."  考える is more like thinking to solve a problem: thinking about physics or math.

labels: 1/2 KANA
NUBI

meaning: to be literally apart from something (miss the target by 3 cm= 3cmはずれ)(the cloth was 3 cm over the limit, and stuck out of the arm-holes) (to be off the mark, out of line, etc.)
to be cut off, to be outside. A door is off its hinges.  A person is ostracized. Something is so incredible you can't even believe it.
to literally raise (your hands, and wave them from side to side; the roof)
rise up : Sometimes literal (climb a ladder, go up hill) , but usually figuragive ( To rise to stardom, a cost that runs as high as a billion annually).
SUFFIX meaning, 'in terms of.' For example, ネット上 (he's big on the internet, but not really anywhere else) or 歴史上 (historically)

meaning: to occupy or seize. I'm sitting in this seat so you can't sit in this seat.
a point, a dot.  This is used in 2 ways;

in the beginning. . . first of all. . .
Something stands up; something is set up.

meaning: an interval of time - the time between event A and event B.
gate - never used by itself, though. Only in jukugo - sort of like a second ONyomi. (see below!)

meaning: to ask (BOOBOO: only used in a formal situation, where the wrong answer spells trouble: - the police questioned the suspect, the situation calls his authority into question)

meaning: last time (i.e. "Thanks for helping me last time.")
something is cut off, something breaks. To get your electricity cut off.
understand. (BOOBOO - Not 'understand' like 'I know the capital of Australia", but more like, "Oh! NOW I get it! DON'T call them skanks! ')
it was divided; it branched into ２ sections.
tiny (means the same as ちいさい but is more cute-sounding)

meaning: just a little - not enough. (Not necessarily a bad meaning: "The risks are negligible.")
a literal line, like what you'd draw.

meaning: to be involved with, to get caught up in,(usually in a bad thing)
To use. (More formal/scientific than つかう） As in, "Please use this pencil to complete the test.

meaning: to chat (BOOBOO; If you want to ask someone if they speak Japanese, Don't ever say "nihongo hanaseru?"- that's strictly NOOB. say "Nihongo SHABERU?" instead)
a story. as in, 'Here's a little story I've got to tell. . . !'

labels: 1/2 KANA

meaning: in the middle, halfway (mid-30s, middle of June, mid-century)
labels: KANA

meaning: refers to small villages in general, as in "Country life is more peaceful than city life." （BOOBOO: if you want to talk about a particular village, generally you'd say 村　（むら））  里 also has the nuance of being the village where you are from (used when nostalgic). Also,　you use　里 when a wife leaves her husband - "She went back to the sato."
tie a knot. tie your shoelaces.
to get old, a somewhat perjorative term: Danny Glover saying 'I'm too old for this shit!' - "Dumbledore's getting old, he makes mistakes."Also means "To be a kid but look older than you are."
another word for 'to get old, to age', but without the perjorative connotation of ふける。
to be enough. Often used in the negative. XXXが足りない!
means foot AND leg. Oops. They don't have a separate word.
correct, in BOTH senses : literally , as in a correct answer. (Implies that there is ONLY ONE correct one). And figuratively: something that is morally correct or just.
to ordain or determine (either a rule, a plan, or a time and place for something).

meaning: To take a picture. Also, to pick something up off a table or shelf, pick up a small thing like glasses or a plate. Also means to get something (good marks on a test, a prize, etc,).
the most (the biggest, the best, the ugliest, etc.)
to hear a sound (whether intentionally or not)
to listen to something (radio, TV);be able to hear something.
near - both physically, in time, and metaphorically, as in 'Your left boob is so stretched, it's nearly a banana.'
forest : often goes after the name of a specific forest, i.e. "the black forest" would be 黒森

LAZY

meaning: a break (a day off=休みの日)
relax, to take a day off
(used about an angry person or weather) to settle down, relent
to become friendly, to calm down (なごませる： to calm someone/something down)
this kanji is 'watashi' if you're a formal guy, and 'atashi' if you're a formal lady.If you're an old guy, you can say, 'washi,' and if you're addressing a superior person you'd say 'wataKUshi.'

meaning: ｔｈｅ　end of something- end of the month, the end of a story
my younger sister (BOOBOO: if I address YOUR younger sister, it's 'いもうとさん')
raw, uncooked rice. The kind you buy in a big 2 kilo bag.
to be sticky  - usually shortened to  the onomopoetic word ネバネバ!

gratitude. Unlike the related words 恩恵　（おんけい） and 義理 (ぎり）, 恩 means that you really WANT to do something nice, to give back to the person you're grateful to. Also, unlike 義理、恩 doesn't imply that you owe them a specific favor. Often, 恩 is used like, "Everyone else gave up on me, told me I was a juvenile delinquent, that I'd amount to nothing. That teacher was the only one who believed in me, who kept encouraging me no matter how many times I fucked up. とても恩がある。"

to be in trouble. . . .not exactly. It doesn't mean 'punishment' like  'You're in trouble!' means in English. It's not like  your teacher yelling at you. Often you'd use it like "Oh, shit!" If you're late and can't find your shoes, that's こまった.  (past tense) If you're lost, that's こまった. If you forgot your password for ratemycheneyfanfiction.org, that's . . . actually you're better off, probably. (BOOBOO)

low (temperature, blood pressure,low voice, low hill)
sleepy from being up all day (BOOBOO: not to be confused with being tired from work or exercise, which is 疲れる)
it bends or curves (the road, the path, the tree-trunk)
a piece of music - a song, if you will

meaning: abundant - like a rainforest abundant in life or a country's abundant natural resources. You can also use it for a person - he has a lot of education or a wealth of wisdom. (but not used for actual dollars - in that case you'd use 裕福 (yuufuku)。）
just like the other 'au' (合う) but only used with sudden and random disasters, such as a car accident, a mugging, etc.
thick or dense, like a dense fog or really strong coffee.

to pretend to be something you're not.

meaning: climbー only used with mountains, cliffs and ladders.

SUFFIX attatched to a place or thing , meaning 'close to' or 'on the border or edge of' something- usually used with locations: 'I'm standing on the edge of the ocean, where it meets the shore.' It is pronounced GIWA.

meaning: CULTURAL CODE WORD. To infer the feelings of other people (usually in the sense of being a good host or sentitive friend) (as opposed to 気が利く , which refers to actually physically doing something for that person, based on what you さっするed!).

meaning: to rub, to wear out, to lose one's naivety.

meaning: easy,simple to do. (BOOBOO: don't mix it up with the other 'yasashii' (優し), which means kindhearted)

meaning: This is one of the more weird words. . . You don't use this for 'raise your hand' or 'raise a barbell over your head.' You use this for hoisting a flag, deep-frying tempura, and honestly that's about it. How's that for random?
damage to one's body. Broken bones and such (visible or not).
to　 damage (smoking meth damages your teeth ; the fungus damages the crops)

is this always KANA? Yes. You don't need the kanji for this. Oh, by the way, it means 'To deviate, diverge, go wide of the mark.'

various meanings. . . .to make something flow - to flush a toilet. - Also means, a DJ plays music. Which is pretty rad.
something is literlly flowing. Also used when music is playing on the loudspeaker, or when time passes (時間が流れると。。。。）(literally, 'In the course of time . . .. ').

To be scared into complying or obeying.

it doesn't move or expand (crime rate doesn't change / the jerkface politician remains in office / the damage is limited to this)

meaning: I tell someone (use this one for, "Tell her I said hello!")

most dictionaries/books/apps define this as POWER but it's more like momentum, (a power which is in motion). refers to the skin of a person - not to leather or animal skin (BOOBOO)
to starve (xxxにうえてる =  metaphorically hungry for xxx (knowledge or power ,etc.))
to dread or really fear something.Basically the same as 怖がる  but a little more formal.

to establish (a committee to look into the matter)（a political party), to found (a hospital or think tank) , provide (money) , or throw (a party for a valuable customer) . More broad and casual than the related term 設定（せってい）
crotch (BOOBOO: usually  people say またのとこと)

to be cool-headed, prudent, or discreet when it comes to something potentially disruptive. Could also be translated as 'refrain', like, 'refrain from smoking or talking loudly.' 'Don't say fuck. Watch your lanauge when you talk to nuns.'

literally, to hang or suspend something.   But since usually Japanese use the 掛 kanji to mean hang, 懸 is more often used figuratively: meaning, to gamble or stake something. One's life, one's heart, one's money, etc.
it is hanging / it depends on xxx. Perhaps more accurately, "XXX is at stake."
to put something down (put a pack of anchovies down on the bear's carcass) (that's not a mnemonic, BTW. That's just what I usually put down and where I usually put it).
